characters: AS SUDDENLY THE CAGE DOORS SNAF OPEN
JUST AS A SECOND WHITE APE RISES
A MASSIVE HERD OF FLYING MALAGORS
AS SAB THAN MATERIALIZES AMIDST THIRTY THARKS
AND SUDDENLY BLUE RADIUM BOLTS OPEN FIRE
WITH TARS AND CARTER AT THE REINS
AND ALLOWING A PACK OF CALOTS TO CHARGE OUT
AS A DOZEN MALAGORS AND RIDERS TAKE TO THE AIR
AS THE TWO FLIERS COLLIDE WITH THE TOWER
A GARGANTUAN AIRSHIP IN THE CLOUDS
AND TACKLES THE PILOTS ABOARD THEIR FLIER
AND VAXX TAKES A ROARING, RUNNING LEAP
TO SEE A TWENTY-FOOT TALL WHITE APE
MAY WE ONCE MORE PRAISE THEIR NAMES
AND SKYROCKETS WAY PAST THE BRANCH
LEADING THE SIX OTHER TRIBES OF THARKS
JUST AS ENERGY BOLTS FIRE FROM THE FIRE-GEMS
THE FIFTY THARKS COME STORMING IN
THE CURVED BONE SPIRE CRACKS FREE
AS A CAVALCADE OF HORNS SOUND
AND TWO TIGER-LIKE BANTHS CLAMBER OUT
TO REVEAL THE PRINCESS OF MARS
AND A BLUE PULSE-BOLT RIPS RIGHT AT
TO SEE A YOUNG AFRICAN BOY
TO CRASH-LAND IN THE PALACE GARDENS
TWELVE SILHOUETTED RIDERS ON THE ROCKS BEYOND
TO FIND HIMSELF IN A FIELD OF BLUE FLOWERS
THE ENTIRE CHAMBER RUMBLES WITH ENERGY
AND SLAMS BACKWARDS AGAINST A TREE TRUNK
TO SEE THE GREEN-AND-BLACK FLAGS OF THE THARK RIDERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Endless green, lush and wild, extends to the horizon...as soar with two MILITARY HELICOPTERS. On a mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COMBAT BOOT splashes down amidst torrential rain. It be to CAPTAIN JOHN CARTER (28), of Dev Group, the most elite special forces units. He’s handsome but world-weary. A wi beyond his years. He spins at a close sound -- rifle now aimed at a tiny RE LIZARD, who regards him like a visitor from another plane

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (into radio) Clear. Three seconds later, a DOZEN ARMY RANGERS fast rope into all around him, at the base of their tethers-- --dropping from the two HELICOPTERS hovering above. The C WASH whips the terrain, but the rainstorm drowns the soun little lizard darts away for his life. A soldier lands next to Carter -- JAMES POWELL (27), all tattoos, attitude, rock & roll. James Dean with a captain commission. They trade a nod. Nice landing. And then watch as a CIA MAN descends on the last tether, the clearing, crashing through branches and landing in a on his ass. Amused, Powell locks to Carter:

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: War is hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BINOCULAR POV of a jungle settlement -- a village of hu shacks, now occupied by members of an AFRICAN REBEL ARMY. handful of ragtag SOLDIERS, one with a Stinger launcher.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ten I can see. AK's, RPG‘S...two Jeeps with machine gun mounts. Intel's right about the Stingers. Carter (lowering the binocs), lies next to Powell, hidden jungle’s edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The villagers are being held ina school house on the northeast edge.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Take five men from the east and eliminate every rebel you encounter. I'll do the same from the south.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What about the civilians? Powell doesn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: We're here to liberate them... right?

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: If possible.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What have you and that spook cooked up? Powell gives Carter a long look.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Okay. You gotta right to know. Story is some gemstone showed up at a London jeweler’s. The CIA got hold of it. Turns out to be a whole new type of mineral. Never seen before. Has some amazing properties. Lots of uses. Lasers...and other tech stuff. They traced it back to this village. We've been ordered to locate and secure the source. Everything else is secondary.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Once again, they feed us a phony story so we’ll do their dirty work.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: It's the job.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Maybe. But I’m still coming in from the Northeast. Carter starts to head out. Powell sighs.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Bad tactics. But we’ll all go in from the Northeast. Isolate the civilians first.  3. Powell sticks out his fist. Carter bumps it with his fist

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Still friends?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Womb to tomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KABOOM! CONCUSSION GRENADES blast through the walls, caus quartet of REBEL OFFICERS to dive for cover. Maps and min samples scatter to the ground--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --as the Army Ranger unit STORMS the village from all sid SHARPSHOOTERS lay down cover fire, as Carter, Powell and race to cover of mud huts-- --picking off REBELS as‘they'race into view, guns blazing chaotic urban warfare, deep in a remote jungle. Carter and Powell advance with care as RAT-A-TATATATA! -- AUTOMATIC FIRE eats up the dirt dead ahead. A GUNNER in a thatched-roof tower atop a tribal worship house fires a M GUN. Carter’s on his radio:

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Sniper in the compound! A REBEL JEEP pulls into view from the other direction. Tw rebels with Kalashnikovs take a bead on Carter and Powell

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --forcing them to dive inside as mud walls get RIDDLED wi gunfire. Holes POP just above the level of their heads. P glares at Carter, who frowns--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Never say it’s your last mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Powell dart out another way, trading FIRE with chasing Jeep. Powell takes out the DRIVER and the Jeep cr Carter sees the Tower Gunner facing the other way--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cover. --and races for the worship house. Powell lays cover fire

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! Carter blows through the door, picking off two REBE OFFICERS before they can fire back. The building has been converted into a rebel command post. A SENIOR OFFICER sta FIRING, as Carter dives for cover-- --falling amidst MAPS, CHARTS and SOIL SAMPLES. Massive m of DIRT and CRUSHED ROCK fall around him. Geological test EQUIPMENT tumbles off tables as GUNFIRE rings out. Carter braces for a shot -- and now sees the SENIOR OFFIC his gun to the head of a FEMALE VILLAGER, bound in an interrogation chair. The officer SHOUTS threats--— --and Carter doesn’t hesitate. BAM! be theese His shot kills the Officer. Carter springs to the ladder-stairs to the Tower and clim behind the Machine Gunner, levelling his rifle-- --as the Machine Gunner whirls on him and OPENS FIRE-- --just as Carter DROPS back through the trap door, landin The Hulking Gunner abandons his post and LEAPS through th in pursuit. With a huge machete-- --and CRASH! Carter blocks the machete strike with his ri wielding it like a two-handed sword. The Gunner CLASHFS a and Carter parries. The huge rebel drives Carter back, SL madly-- --and KNOCKING the gun from Carter’s hands. Carter hits t deck. The Gunner plants a BOOT on his neck just as Carter for his ankle-holstered pistol-- --and the machete comes down just as the pistol goes up-- --and BAM! The Gunner falls. Sideways. Carter looks to see Powell in the doorway, rifle smoking. both catch their breath, exhausted...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I had him.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Whatever you say.  5. The sounds of GUNFIRE fade, replaced by SHOUTS of “All Se Their unit's taken the village. They swiftly free the bon the female prisoner-- A ranger arrives on the scene.

dialogues.speaker: RANGER
dialogues.text: The village has been taken. All civilians are safe and secure in the school.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Help her to the others. The Ranger escorts the Woman out. Carter picks up MAPS fr scattered rock samples and equipment...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Well, they were up here looking for rocks, all right.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (a strange tone) Yeah. Yeah they were. 4 And Carter turns to see what Powell’s staring at... On the tribal altar, there’s a SUNDIAL-shaped totem made baked red clay...with six gem-sized indentations in it -- - encircling a larger center indentation. It is filled with an INCANDESCENT FIRE-RED GEMSTONE, whic lit from within by an otherworldly glow. The gem absolute takes their breath away. And off their looks of pure amazement...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARMY RANGERS cut the locks on the doors-- ~-as IMPRISONED VILLAGERS spill out, bound and blindfolde soldiers free their bonds and the villagers embrace them- --as Carter and Powell watch from the worship house door. CIA Man arrives, storming right past them--

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: It’s in there, Spooky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain has stopped as HELICOPTERS set down, bringing su personnel...and more INTELLIGENCE OPERATIVES, who are rus toward the worship house by the CIA Man. At the village's edge, Carter and Powell sit, scraping mu their boots, looking like hell...

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: I'm gonna miss saving your life, you know.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Won't miss saving yours.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: We get home, we're gonna change our minds. We'll take two weeks and want to be right back in it. Carter smiles. Shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: What about the private security work? You still thinking about it? Us ex- Dev Group guys can make a lot of money.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I'm tired of killing.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: But you're so good at it.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Ironic. Isn't it? Another Ranger voice CRACKLES over Powell’‘s radio--

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Gold Team -- South Perimeter -- please report.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: We got jungle and more jungle. Anybody needs some, send ‘em on over. He clicks off. Carter still surveys the jungle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just trying to picture you -- back there in the Blue Ridge, building your little house on a hill without a war to fight. Carter smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I‘11 send you a postcard. And suddenly a RUSTLING in the jungle springs them to the feet! Their rifles are ready, instantly on alert... ..-and then Carter, scanning the trees, spots A PAIR OF E amidst jungle foliage.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Ten o'clock! A DARK FIGURE takes off running -- just as Carter sights rifle. Carter and Powell leap into action!

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Go, go, go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two soldiers CRASH through the underbrush, giving cha

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: (into radio) We‘ve got a rebel on the south perimeter! We're in pursuit! --as they SMASH through huge leaves and dangling vines, a fleeing FIGURE stays far ahead of them, visible only as a DISTURBANCE in the overgrown jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Powell LEAP a stream, as more LIZARDS watch-- --and keep CRASHING through dense jungle, running hard an blind, finally bursting through into a--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where a few VINES hang down, just overhead, from high tre They catch their breath, listening for movement-- --and then see a RUSTLING in the jungle ahead. Then sever yards further. And further still. Powell starts for it--  8. --but Carter grabs his arm. Powell frowns. Carter points the vine right beside his head. It’s swaying gently, whil rest of the vines are not. Together, they grip their rifles...and snap them upward--

dialogues.speaker: TO SEE A YOUNG AFRICAN BOY
dialogues.text: Clutching the vine twenty feet above them. He wears a sat and has a handful of stones he's been throwing. Surprised two friends hold their fire... CARTER . (in broken dialect) Climb down, we won't hurt you. We're not with the rebels. But the Boy remains clinging, scared. Powell’s had enough

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: The hell with this. --as he raises his rifle and FIRES -- snapping the vine! --and sending the AFRICAN BOY tumbling twenty feet to the He lands on his butt, as his satchel spills open and-- SIX MORE INCANDESCENT RED “FIRE-GEMS” Fall out, GLOWING MAGICALLY as if from within. Carter and Powell's eyes go wide. The Boy gasps, then scrambles to r them...but Powell keeps him at bay...

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Carter...?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yeah. I see ‘em. Carter picks up the glowing stones, with wonderment...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Your village...did they tell you to hide these? From the rebels? How long have you been out here hiding? The Boy trembles. He looks like he hasn't eaten in weeks. Carter trades a look with Powell...and puts the stones ba the boy’s satchel.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I want you to take these back to your people. Don't let our soldiers see them. They belong to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter, what are you doing? Carter hands the grateful boy the satchel.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Now I want you to tell me something. The Boy nods.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Those rocks. Do you know where your village found them? Another nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter, Powell and the Boy push through the foliage to em an overlook -- with a view of e lush MOUNTAIN RANGE risin the clouds. Near'*the base, a JAGGED CREVASSE cuts into t range like a deep, black scar. The Boy is happily devouring a Baby Ruth candy bar as he to the canyon and speaks a single African word.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: He says “the cave.” He raises binocs, intrigued. Powell consults a map:

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Whatcha got on that crevasse?

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: It's not here. It’s not charted.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: There was an earthquake around here a year ago. Could’ve opened it up. They trade a long look...as their radios CRACKLE:

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Base to Gold Team, base to Gold Team...report on pursuit. Carter raises his radio...until Powell takes it away:

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah, we lost that rebel...still out here searching. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL (cont'd) Might've found their supply route, though. Gonna have a look. May take some time.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Copy that. Good luck, Gold Team.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Thanks. We'll need it. Powell clicks off..-.and meets Carter's gaze...
Carter and Powell trek toward the crevasse, hacking jungl

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: We're taking a look, right? A look.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: That is the mission.

dialogues.speaker: " CARTER
dialogues.text: We take a gem, it’s a court-martial.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: We take one, we take ten, I know.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: We don’t even know what they’re worth--

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Besides killing for. Suddenly, the narrow CREVASSE opens up before them. ominous ribbon, a crack in the earth. Depth unknown.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: We’ve been doing this for fifteen years. For who, our country? No. NSA, CIA, guys like Spooky. Their wars, their agendas. What are we leaving this Army with?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: We're alive. There's that. Powell studies the dark abyss, with a measured tone:

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: You ever seen gems like that? How much land in the Blue Ridge you think one of them buys? Forget private security work. A few of those rocks and we never have to kill anyone ever again. A dark  ll. Carter weighs this. Powell pushes the moment.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: We've been best friends for fifteen years right?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: More or less.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: How many times before this have I asked you to break the rules?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I‘ve lost count.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: So what's one more? Carter laughs. Powell holds a hopeful stare.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Alright, but after we find the stones we're going to turn them over to the brass.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: After I put a few aside for my old age.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: That’s between you and your court- martial tribunal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell DESCENDS on a rope line, lowered by Carter. He fee way down jagged walls, scanning a light across the walls spotting flecks of worthless QUARTZ and MICA.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Lots of rocks -- no pretty redheads!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How far down you figure? Powell scans with his light. Still only blackness.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Good goddamn question. More rope?! Fifty feet above him, a silhouetted Carter shakes his hea below, Powell now spots a series of LEDGES, like a natura staircase. He starts swinging himself--  12.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: There's some ledges here, I think I can get a little deeper-- --and as he swings, the rope FRAYS against some rock...bu Powell grabs hold in time. He perches on a ledge--

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm gonna unhook-- --and as he unclips from the rope line, the ledge CRUMBLE Powell flails and tumbles, plummeting into darkness! His TERRIFYING YELL echoes -- and then abruptly cuts silent.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Powell?! POWELL!!! No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter tears back into the foliage, SLASHING at long,’ st vines...and hustling to tie their ends together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the vines secured to a tree, Carter takes a knife an carves a STAR AND TWO STRIPES symbol into the tree. Then backs to the edge of the crevasse. His FLASHLIGHT is tape his belt, aimed downward. He takes a deep breath--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I‘m coming for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far away, Carter disappears into the crevasse. Watching h the African Boy..-.wearing an enigmatic stare:

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Goodbye, soldier. He crunches another bite of Baby Ruth. And he’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter rappels through the opening, navigating far past t crumbling ledges and the end of Powell's rope-- --and then his light finds the bottom of the crevasse. Wi broken end of Powell’s rope. And traces of BLOOD.  13. Carter scrambles to the end of his vines...and drops six the crevasse floor. He scans his light...following drops blood...to the dark, jagged mouth of a CAVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter wanders through the pitch darkness--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Powell?! Can you hear me? There's no reply. But his light illuminates STRANGE MARKI the walls -- characters, shapes and symbols in an unknown language. Intrigued, Carter edges deeper-~- --and now his LIGHT picks up a GLINT OF RED. He stops sti Ahead, through an archway, he sees twinkling RED LIGHTS - dozens of them -- like constellations in the sky. He stumbles closer, passing through the archway into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive chamber, a domed room thirty feet high with tho of mystical RED FIRE-GEM CRYSTALS in the walls. More MARKINGS, coordinates in an unknown language, are ca bas-relief all around the base of the chamber. The room w clearly built by an intelligence...but whose? Carter marvels, circling the room. He runs his hands acro fire-gems. They shimmer BRIGHTER to his touch.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What is this...? Then, Carter spots something in the middle of the room. A SUNDIAL-type marking in the ground. Like a compass charti both time and space. And as he edges closer--~ --he kneels to examine it, seeing a large DIAMOND-like st the center, reflecting infinite facets. And as he just ba touches it with one of his hands--

dialogues.speaker: THE ENTIRE CHAMBER RUMBLES WITH ENERGY
dialogues.text: As if ACTIVATED. The “sundial” Carter’s kneeling on LOWER abruptly into the ground, causing a WHITE GLOW to spill o instinct, Carter scrambles aside-- --and sees the canopy of FIRE-GEMS GLOW BRIGHTER, as if instantly charged. They CRACKLE with energy, as the HUM g deafening, and RED BEAMS of ENERGY “connect” linking all erystals in a spiderweb network--  14. Carter's astonished...as a SWIRLING WIND begins to build, the FIRE-GEMS glow hotter, illuminating PREHISTORIC FOSSI the walls, embedded DINOSAURS and MASTODONS--~- --while the dinosaur and mastodon fossils GROW SKIN AND P and suddenly COME TO LIFE, as meanwhile the cavern ceilin SPLITS APART to reveal the night sky high above-- --and the HUM grows deafening and the GLOW blinding and t now SPINNING at impossible speed as Carter sees--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the rock above him retracts and the DINOSAURS clamber backwards from their eternal resting places and Carter's buffeted body shakes as if it's being ripped apart-- --in the maelstrom of sound and light and time which casc into a sudden SONIC BOOM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a distant angle, DINOSAURS watch as a PILLAR OF RED-HO fires straight up into the universe beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amidst a low blanket of reeds and tall grasses, RED ENERG CRACKLES and SPARKS. Angle rises to reveal a circle of flattened, burned grasses...with John Carter, unconscious scorched and battered, at its center. Carter struggles up. Disoriented and nauseous. Confused t he‘s no longer in the crevasse cave. He's surrounded by strange foliage -- blacks, browns and Silvers. Arid and harsh. A jungle, yes, but nothing like one he was in. There’s a craggy tree canopy overhead. Unn insect chattering and faint avian calls.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Powell?! POWELL!!! He grabs his equipment belt, checks his compass. Its need SPINNING wildly. His GPS readout is blank.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (into radio) Gold Team to base. This is Carter to base, do you read me? I've lost a fix on my position.  15. His radio CRACKLES and HISSES with static. And then he he different CLICK-HISSSS. CLICK-HISSSSS. An insect-like pur near his right ear. He turns, careful and slow...and sees a BABY MALAGOR perc a reed only inches from his cheek. Like a tiny four- wing pterodactyl. It cocks its head, curious. Even cute. --as the Baby Malagor BARES TERRIFYING FANGS and HISSES-- --and Carter RECOILS, instantly disappearing from frame--

dialogues.speaker: AND SLAMS BACKWARDS AGAINST A TREE TRUNK
dialogues.text: Eyes shut, Carter winces, rubbing his skull. Back to the he lifts his head to see-- THAT HE‘S FIFTEEN FEET OFF THE GROUND Straddling a large branch, with the ground far below him. Baby Malagor hasn't moved. But it’s twenty feet away. Carter blinks, confused. He swings a leg over the branch and lowers himself, dangl a moment, then dropping carefully to the ground. He looks upward at the tree branch, fifteen feet up. Test the thought, he crouches low...and then leaps.

dialogues.speaker: AND SKYROCKETS WAY PAST THE BRANCH
dialogues.text: Shooting far higher -- twenty, thirty, forty feet -- CRAS through branches and flailing for purchase. Finally, he g hold of one. Dangling, he looks down-- --and sees the tiny Baby Malagor still observing. Intrigu Carter drops from the tree, his hands trembling. He crouc grasping the ground as if afraid to let go.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What happened to gravity? Chancing it, Carter slowly rises back to his full height. Nothing happens. He surveys the terrain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter comes SOARING from the forest canopy, arcing groun to land in a crouch. He's breathing hard, gauging the dis he just leaped...  16.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (incredulous) What happened to me...? He rises to face a rising rock slope. He picks up a large of black rock, testing its weight. To his amazement, he’s to toss it easily in his hand-- --and then he wheels and hurls it like a discus, watching PIROUETTE high over the rise and out of sight. Somewhere distant, there’s a creature’s throaty CALL of dismay. And off Carter's stunned reaction...

dialogues.speaker: A MASSIVE HERD OF FLYING MALAGORS
dialogues.text: comes SOARING over the rise, dozens of them, riding the w like four-winged dragons. Carter dives for hiding as they over the trees...where the Baby Malagor gives Carter one HISS and ascends to join his family. Carter blinks. He can’t believe his eyes as he marches to edge of the rise for a vantage of--

dialogues.speaker: A SWEEPING MARTIAN LANDSCAPE
dialogues.text: Like an African savanna, with a shallow marshy pond below teems with a panoply of MARTIAN WILDLIFE. Bizarre desert predators the size of dinosaurs... ...and all framed against a STARSCAPE backdrop, with the planet rising prominently...a familiar ringed planet fill sky.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (stunned) I‘m dead... have to be... Above a nearby rock outcrop, he can see the top of a TALL TOWER. It looks man-made. His eyes narrow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staying out of sight of the watering hole predators, Cart scales the rocks for a view of what’s beyond... -.. and sees a great DOMED STRUCTURE built into the hills with a glistening egg-shaped dome. Its incongruity in the landscape and softness of its lines suggest that it was d and built.  17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter jumps to a spire and looks down upon the dome... T a thick, curved, transparent roof, he sees HUNDREDS OF EG feet high, three feet in diameter, with a leathery white Sunlight is refracted through the dome and grows with int providing heat. The building’s purpose is clear - it is a INCUBATOR. --And guarding the entrance are two CALOTS - formidable, ferocious creatures about six feet long, as thick as a rh with ten stubby legs, frog-like heads with three rows of and tusks jutting from wide jaws. One might think of an ugly/cute English Bulldog when looking at them, but one c could eat five Earth dogs for breakfast. Carter hears a GROWL. Turning, he comes face-to-face with THIRD CALOT (whom he will later name WOOLA). Stouter than others, with an endearing patch of color around one eye, regards Carter with curiosity...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Easy boy... Woola GROWLS a low woola-woola-woola, and edges a step fo his eyes flaring with alarm..

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: ...I’'m not going to hurt you... .+..as a HUGE SHADOW falls over both Carter and Woola, an realizes that’s what the beast was growling at. Carter sw hard...and swiftly spins--

dialogues.speaker: TO SEE A TWENTY-FOOT TALL WHITE APE
dialogues.text: SHATTERING two RIGHT FISTS through the glass of the incub dome, CLAWS OPENING to snatch its newfound prey-- --just as Carter dives aside, and scrambles up -- only to BASHED by a hulking hairy forearm as it swings back, send COLLIDING through the incubator’s wall -- back outside. The maniacal creature has two legs, four arms and a head gorilla’s. Its claws SMASH into two of the eggs instead, hauling out TWO STICKY GREEN FETAL CREATURES. The mucous- covered, four-armed blind babies WRITHE and SQUEAL-- --as the White Ape devours them whole, gnashing jaws, slu and swallowing...and then turns Carter’s way.  18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter grabs his pistol and OPENS FIRE. The bullets peppe Ape’s chest like BB’s. Completely harmless.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Not good-- He scrambles, colliding with one of the dead calots. The animal's ribcage is exposed -- and Carter's able to snap scimitar-like RIB for a weapon-- --just as the White Ape LUNGES for him, landing on its mi limbs and flashing out its upper claws-- --and Carter LEAPS straight up, just missing its grasp, t perch on the side of the dome. Surprised, the Ape turns-- ~-just as Carter takes a desperate jump -- right at it, EMBEDDING the rib in its neck as Carter sails past its sh and lands hard in the dirt, tumbling to a stop. The Ape H MADLY, staggered but not killed-- --and LEAPS again out of the enraged animal's grasp, land atop the rock outcrop and racing over its summit--~

dialogues.speaker: JUST AS A SECOND WHITE APE RISES
dialogues.text: into view to cut him off! Even larger and more savage tha first, it BACKHANDS two arms before Carter can react-- --swatting him like a fly to SMASH HIM BACK THROUGH THE D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and crash-land among the eggs. A human throw toy. In ag Carter rolls onto his back. To see Woola the calot lying to him, with ugly but sympathetic eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You take the big one-- As SMASH! The larger Male Ape LUMBERS through the destroy entry. The Female Ape LIMPS to his side, with the calot-r still stuck in her neck. They thrash the grasses as Carte Woola both scamper for better cover-- The Female Ape SCOOPS up an egg, bites off the top and su the fetal creature inside. She then CRUSHES the eggshell HURLS it at Carter, knocking him down-- --and allowing the Male to GRAB him! The Male raises him in the air, opening his savage JAWS wide, ready to thrust down his gullet--  19.

dialogues.speaker: WHEN WOOLA CHARGES INTO VIEW
dialogues.text: Taking a flying leap at the Ape‘s legs, SINKING jaws in a wrenching a leg out from under. The Male buckles, looseni grip -- and allowing Carter to tumble free. Trapped between them, Carter sees the Female blocks the e Carter glances to the roof, then steels his gaze-- And races at the Female. She drops low, ready for his cha until he plants off an egg and LEAPS skyward! Soaring straight up to the dome’s roof, where he hangs on broken girder with one hand, dangling right above her wid gnashing jaws-- Carter hangs on by one hand, about to fall to his doom... opens the other hand...to reveal a CONCUSSION GRENADE.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Compliments of the U.S. Army. And lets it drop. Right down the ape’s throat. The ape ROARS...and then gets silenced as the grenade DET ravaging the ape with internal injuries from its concussi force! The beast topples to ground, dead. Carter falls -- but lands safely in the silvergrass. The Ape BELLOWS mournfully, HURLING Woola at Carter. With a thundering run, he blocks any other escape. They’re done He BEATS his chest, and now CHARGES!--

dialogues.speaker: AS SUDDENLY HIS TORSO ERUPTS
dialogues.text: With black blood and a GREEN FLASH, as if EXPLODING from The Ape staggers...and then topples, revealing--

dialogues.speaker: TWELVE SILHOUETTED RIDERS ON THE ROCKS BEYOND
dialogues.text: Like a military platoon, except the silhouettes aren’t hu They are THARKS, twelve feet tall and four~armed green wa adorned in armor and battlements, riding THOATS, great pa horse/part-rhino cavalry animals. One among them holds a SMOKING RADIUM RIFLE. His gun give steady, “recharging” whine. The rest await this leader’s command. He is GENERAL TARS TARKAS. The riders descend the rocks, approaching. Twin tusks cur upward from their jawbones. Hairless heads, menacing face armed to the teeth with spears, swords and rifles.  20. Carter tenses -- he drops his “knife” and opens his hands show he means no harm. The Tharks (among them savage, scar-faced LIEUTENANT VAXX look to TARS TARKAS, the leader, awaiting an order. Tars motions for all to lower their guns.

dialogues.speaker: VAXX
dialogues.text: (to Tars, gesturing angrily) Loquesh va baresh! Baresh ku tain! Tars holds him with a steely look. Vaxx falls silent. Car keeps a surrendering pose, but addresses Tars:

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: My name is John Carter. Do you understand me? Tars betrays nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’m not your enemy? I’m lost. I’m trying to find a friend.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: (intrigued) Friend. Carter nods, warily relaxes. Tars lowers his rifle. And t points to his own armor:

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Thark. Curious, Tars dismounts and notes the smashed incubator w the destroyed eggs, the two dead calots, and the wounded He picks up the blade fashioned from the rib, points at t white ape, and asks Carter...

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Baresh?! Baresh ku tain? Getting the gist of the question, Carter nods in the affirmative, but moves to the wounded Woola and adds...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: They attacked us. We were able to kill one. Upon hearing Carter’s English, the Tharks look befuddled. clanks as Tars raises a single finger...and presses it to Carter's chest. A testing touch.  21.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: That‘’s right. Him and me. Tars nods, with some amusement, then strides past Carter examines the calot’s wound, calling to Vaxx who THROWS A at Woola! A shocked Carter SPRINGS in the air and SNATCHE saving the calot’s life.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: No! He saved my life. The Tharks don’t know what to make of Carter’s leap! An a sound is heard as they look on in awe. TWO see it as an a aggression, LAUNCH spears at him, and Carter VAULTS to a avoiding both projectiles.

dialogues.speaker: SHENN
dialogues.text: Heeding Tars‘s order, the warriors sheath weapons. Carter his thanks and returns to Woola...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: These boys think you're done for. You want to live? Move. The calot “smiles” and gets to its feet. Carter looks to fars... The Thark nods - Woola will be spared. Tars Tarkas remains impossible to read...but something ak smile crosses his face...and he finally signals sharply. thunder of armor, all Tharks DISMOUNT at once. Vaxx curses, lowering his weapons, with vengeful eyes dir Carter‘’s way. And when Tars turns his back, Vaxx kicks W sent tumbling across the dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Apes’ bodies BURN and their PELTS are loaded onto tho while Tharks are busy repairing the shattered dome. A stunned Carter sits prisoner, hands and feet bound by C Woola’s beside him, looking forlorn. They watch Tars marc the scene, commanding his soldiers-- --as Carter’s radio, on the ground beside him, suddenly S with the sound of GUNFIRE and LASER FIRE, as if tuning in interstellar war.  22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOZEN THARK EGGS hang from baskets and braces, carried Thoats...as Tars Tarkas and his Thark platoon trek across seemingly endless hostile landscape. Amidst the caravan expedition, Carter sits bound atop a t a prisoner. His tired, ragged face looks toward the horizon...and his eyes widen, at what seems like a mirage For from the infinite desert rises a massive METROPOLIS..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nestled in the deep recesses of a dry sea bed lies a crum DOMED city, looming over the tiny riders. Perched on high more MALAGORS. Two launch and SWOOP over the caravan, hel THARK RIDERS in cockpit harnesses. Tars gestures a signal and the Malagors return to the cit SCREECHING an announcement. Soon, TRUMPETS sound and a hu ENTRY GATE is opened.’..two massive iron doors hauled apa lumbering mastodon-sized ZITIDARS... An overwhelmed Carter cannot believe what he's seeing.-. is like watching a fairy tale come to life... Vaxx kicks forward, snapping him back to “reality.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The caravan rides into a dense warren of reclaimed buildi sandstone streets, bustling with THARKS. Thousands of the Citizens BOW at the sight of Tars and his warriors, who a elite of Thark’s military. And they CHEER at the sight of eggs. Tars Tarkas subtly raises a hand to acknowledge the crowd acclaim. A murmur then ripples, as Tharks spot Carter -- regarding him with curiosity and scorn. He can only look with a mind that’s been completely blown...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the city center, a bombed-out cathedral-like building over the rest. Once an architectural wonder, now a deteriorating monument to war. At the caravan’s fore, Tars Tarkas exchange salutes -- th crossing of mid-limbs -- with four PALACE GUARDS.  23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grotesque Thark in a chain-mail cloak, TAL HAJUS, stand dais with three THARK ELDERS and his assassin mistress, S a lovely serpent of a Thark. Hajus spits venom, scrawling lines of troop movement on a (with three of his hands at once). Doors THUNDER open-- --as Tars Tarkas enters, with his senior officers (Vaxx a Jakkal). The room was once a great library or museum left whatever ancient race built the city. Overturned shelves, tables and books litter the floor. Tal Hajus ROARS, angered by the interruption. Tars hurls the APE HEADS at Hajus’ feet. Hajus quiets. Ta calmly drops to a knee. The other Tharks do the same. Hajus frowns at the sight of the pale human, still standi

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: (to Carter, a command) Sakk.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I don't understand-- I don’t know what you want.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Sakk. Tars points to the ceiling. Carter still hesitates. So Ta motions to his officers, who draw SWORDS and attack him-- --giving him no choice but to LEAP right over them, to a perch above the doorway! Tars BARKS another command. His officers HURL their pikes. Carter evades, GAMBOLING from wall to another, flying over their heads. Tars BARKS anot command. The officers stop. Tars smiles, looks to Hajus. can’t help but be impressed.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Sakk. He motions for Carter to come down. Carter does, warily.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: My name’s John Carter, from America. Tars Tarkas and Tal Hajus trade a stare.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Mak jeddak. Lo Jonn-kata. Thark?  24. Hajus eyes Carter carefully, then sneers a dismissive han

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: Thark. BOOM! Palace GUARDS grab Carter, marching him brusquely f the room. And, he believes, to his execution...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Listen to me! I’m looking for a friend. You’re not my enemy, I mean you no harm. : ...and as he resists, the guards BLINDFOLD him and hold h fast...and finally head-butt him into submission. As his world GOES DARK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter’s eyes snap open as he bolts up in bed -- a stack covered burlap, surrounded by chain-mail netting. He's be stripped to his army shorts. But he's alive. The room glows with FIRELIGHT. He sees his washed clothes hanging from a line. He sees a meal left on a table. And hears a throaty PURRING. Woola-woola-woola... Carter turns to see Woola guarding the door, licking his Carter’s eyes narrow...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Woola-woola-woola to you too. He hears RADIO STATIC from behind him. He spins to see an antechamber, where a lithe female Thark, SOLA, sits on th floor, exploring Carter’s military gear: dog tags, compas concussion grenade. She's fiddling with his radio-- CARTER . Hey! That‘s mine! Hey! --he runs over and she springs back, clutching the radio. tries to guard the rest of it--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Get out of here! Go! Mine! --but she bows repeatedly, submissive. He now sees a wash and a cookpit in her room. And now realizes.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You did all this. For me.  25.

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: Sola.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Sola. Sola smiles. In her hands, the radio SQUAWKS to life with inhuman cries and explosions. The sounds of battle. She p it to her ear. Carter‘s eyes widen--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What is that?! What are we hearing?

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: Zodanga. Lok Helium. Dak kavall. She sees he doesn’t understand. So she leads him to a bal stepping out to overlook--

dialogues.speaker: TEE ENTIRE CITY OF THARK
dialogues.text: the broken-domed city teeming with six-limbed, green-skin THARK behemoths. Bustling and training, marching in milit formation by torchlight. But Sola points to the horizon-- --where it GLOWS with FLICKERS of light, abrupt and sudde fireworks from a distant battle. Tiny TRACER LIGHTS are v -- some kind of airships. The FLASH-GLOW moves in concert what Carter’s radio is tuning in--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Dak kavall, she said. Dak kavall. (beat) The war.

dialogues.speaker: NOTEBOOK
dialogues.text: Carter's sandy, bloodstained hands open a tiny military j and start to write...”My name is Captain John Carter, Dev United States Army. I ama prisoner of war...”

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It was incredible. It was impossible. Somehow I had traveled millions of miles through space, and infinite years through time...and yet war remained. Here. Everywhere. War. ANGLE WIDENS to reveal Carter, writing by firelight. Sola asleep in her antechamber, Woola is asleep by the door...  26.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: From that, there was no escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter emerges, followed by Sola and Woola. He wears his clothes, but with Thark touches: a makeshift armored breastplate and Thark DAGGER (which on him, seems a sword attracts the stare of all THARKS passing by...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: The sight of Earth in the sky meant I was still in the same solar system. The red dust, the presence of water... to me, that meant Mars... or as Sola called it, Barsoom. And as for the Martians...Thark was the name -- for their people, their city, and as I came to soon realize...for me. EXT. THARK PLAZA -— DAY Carter and Sola join a CROWD at some kind of public cerem The dozen EGGS that were retrieved from the Incubator sit dais, with necklaces of GREEN FIRE-GEMS draped across the the crystals start to GLOW... ...the eggs crack open, and mewling THARK BABIES emerge, clambering out, sticky and new. The Thark Crowd ROARS, thrusting pikes and swords high. Carter stares, stunned.. ...for as the Babies first rise to stand, they are handed and PIKES of their own. Each then follows a MENTOR THARK a distant “training ground”...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This wasn’t a society, it was a militia. The males, females and children alike. And the general who'd spared my life...wanted me to be a part of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars Tarkas stands watching with his senior OFFICERS, as Thark Babies are taught to fight by their Mentors...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: His name was Tars Tarkas. The rest feared him and obeyed him. To him, I was some kind of prize.  27. +++a€S ANGLE TRACKS the row to find Carter at the end, ho two pikes and learning to defend himself...from Sola.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The strength and agility I now possessed had worth to him in battle. It was all these creatures valued. It’s what they taught their young from the moment they were born. Strength. Valor. Victory. Carter PARRIES two of Sola’s (half-speed) blows, then HOP other two, but her fourth arm HURLS a pike that hits him air. He hits the dirt hard, armor dinged-- --and Sola has a blade to his throat. She shrugs. “Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Their training was much as mine had been. Attempt. Fail. Repeat and repeat again until you succeed. Then repeat until you excel. INT. CARTER’S QUARTERS - DAY A SLIMY MARTIAN RODENT is placed before Carter, on a dinn plate with a charcoal stick. He looks repulsed as Sola si across from him with a plate of her own...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: The one called Sola remained at my side. From her, I began to learn some of their language. Carter motions to his mouth, fearing the worst...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Eat?

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: Tog. Jonn-kata toq.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Jonn-kata toq. He lifts the dripping rodent glop and takes a bite. Gray dribbles down his chin. He chews grimly. Sola wears an amused look. She takes her charcoal stick a strikes it on the table -- it FLAMES alight. She then ske her own gray glop with it. Immediately, the meat COOKS FR WITHIN, roasting to an appetizing smoky brown.  28.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: As the days passed, I tried to find out what I could... There would be no help in my search for Powell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter uses a STONE to draw an etching on the room's wall trying to depict the crevasse cave for Sola: CARTER . It was a cave...with ted crystals. Rocks -- like this -- but red. Vekk. Red. With a diamond in the center -- and when I touched it, it started, all the crystals connected... He draws connecting lines between the crystals he’s drawn (and Woola) watches patiently, trying to follow.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: If it sent me here, it could send me back, right? Have you ever seen this? A cave like this? Sola shakes her head. Carter looks despondent...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: She had no knowledge of a way home. Nor any knowledge of what had happened to Powell. But I would keep looking. EXT. CARTER’S QUARTERS - BALCONY - NIGHT Carter sits perched upon his balcony’s ledge, watching th off GLOW of a firefight beyond the mountains. He has his listening to STATIC and the faint thunder of bombs...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: And every night, I listened to the sounds of war. There was another civilization out there -- one even the Tharks were afraid of -- but who they were and who they fought remained a mystery to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH! A CHILD WARRIOR hits the ground, gored and bleedin rolling away from a bucking, gnashing THOAT -- the Tharks horse/half-rhino, razor-jawed pack animals.  29.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: To the Tharks, I was an alien. An oddity, a pet. But the days turned to weeks, and all the while, Tars Tarkas was watching. Testing... Carter and Sola approach the corral -- enclosed by a fenc of ENERGY BEAMS. Tars Tarkas surveys the training...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And I knew my one chance of survival here was to master their fighting skills...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ENERGY GATE retracts with a HUM, allowing a very reluc Carter to edge in. The simmering thoat SNORTS. But Carter studies the myriad scars on the thoat’s back.. instead unhooks his holster belt. His blades hit the dust Sola and other Tharks trade alarmed looks...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Easy girl. I won‘t hurt you. The thoat stamps hooves like a bull, razor-teeth bared. C reaches out a gentle hand-- --and the thoat CHARGES! Snarling, it lowers its head and COLLIDES with Carter -- who gets plowed backwards across ground -- toward the ENERGY FENCE! At the last second, he manages the leverage to PUSH OFF-- --and bolts SKYWARD, doing a single backflip, then plumme down headfirst just as the thoat REARS UP at the fence-- --as Carter LANDS squarely on its back, hanging on! The t enraged. Tars has seen enough. He BARKS a command to his Wranglers, who aim HARPOON RIFLES--

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: --and wrenches the thoat’s mane to turn her, just as the FIRE! The barbs WHISTLE past, piercing the dirt instead. Carter hangs on, pressed at the thoat’s ear--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Easy now...I won't hurt you... He strokes its flank in a steady rhythm that starts to ca The thoat stops bucking, settling down...  30.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I won't hurt you... ..-till she's finally at rest. Carter rides it over and dismounts, stroking its face. The other Tharks look mysti but Tars Tarkas sagely nods. Well done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter again jousts PIKES with Sola. His hair has grown l and ragged. And this time he out-duels her...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Over time, the walls of my room became a comfort. The taste of my rations and the smell of the desert became familiar...even the sight of Earth in the midnight sky... Carter extends a hand to help Sola up. She seems surprise the gesture. But takes it.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And little by little, the language of the Tharks...became mine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flurry of activity as five THARK GUARDS race past Carte and Woola. Shouts and cries of alarm...which we hear Cart starting to “process”...

dialogues.speaker: THARK GUARDS AS AN ECHO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Lok kalos! Slokell! Munitions house! Intruders! He whirls, trying to follow...

dialogues.speaker: THARK GUARDS AS AN ECHO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Bakvor maggrey! Xanthok Sound the alarms! Alert Tarkas! General Tarkas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! Five Thark Guards burst in -- with Carter and Sola find several dead CALOTS on the ground. Crates of weapons been smashed open and raided.

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: Warhoon!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Warhoon? What‘s a Warhoon?  31. Suddenly, a BARRAGE OF CROSSBOW BOLTS come whizzing from killing three of the guards! Carter and Sola spin to see FIVE SHADOWED SIX-LIMBED FIGU a ledge, scampering for a high window. Shaped like Tharks leaner and even meaner. Carter dives for cover-- --as more BOLTS come flying. The WARHOON ARCHERS clutch pillaged BUSHELS of weapons on their backs as they flee-- --so Carter grabs a RADIUM RIFLE and “charges” it expertl taking a bead on the stone ledge and FIRING! The ledge disintegrates, as three of the Warhoons FALL. T other two drop their stolen weapons and flee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter LEAPS through the window in pursuit and GAMBOLS to outer city wall...where he sees two Warhoon Shadows slip into the desert night. He gets off two GREEN RADIUM BLAST they! explode into the sand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at the window, Carter sees the Thark Guards FIRE mor radium blasts into the fallen Warhoons -- killing them. ( Warhoons are skeletal, Cro-Magnon versions of Tharks.) The Tharks then look to Carter, nodding with respect..

dialogues.speaker: THARK GUARD AS AN ECHO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Tarkas vedd. Sek ott Thark General Tarkas is right. He verras. is truly a Thark. And off this admission, Sola smiles...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Sola was the only one who saw me listening. So she taught me more... INT. CARTER’S QUARTERS - DAY A CRUDE MAP of the planet is spread upon Carter's bed. He Sola sit cross-legged before it. She's explaining...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Malagors. Zitidars. Calots. Thoats. She told me her people lived lifespans of centuries. I wondered whether I would too. She told me of the Warhoon raiders they fought. And of the great war beyond the mountains -- between kingdoms called Zodanga and Helium. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARTER (V.O.) (cont'd) And of the fearsome Sab Than, the Desert Prophet, the Prince of Zodanga, who'd banished the Tharks to this wasteland nearly one hundred years ago. Carter finds his compass, with its lost, spinning needle, holds it up to the map. Explaining directions on Earth...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: And through it all, she was the only Thark who ever asked me of my world. It was as if she'd given up on her own... Suddenly, there’s a POUNDING at ‘the door. Sola rises, an it...to find two stern-faced THARK OFFICERS. Her manner turns grave...as she faces Carter:

dialogues.speaker: SOLA AS AN ECHO, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Mak tek terra. It is your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter's escorted through a crowd -- another ceremonial gathering -- toward the dais. As the way clears... +.-he sees Tars Tarkas waiting for him. With an officer's of THARK ARMOR. And off Carter's shocked look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +++he WEARS THE ARMOR, standing before the Thark crowd as ROAR, thrusting pikes and swords high. Like a Knight of t Round Table...he's one of them now...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Within months...I had gained their acceptance. Was it months -- has it only been months? It is the first thing they teach you in the Army. If you are captured, learn the ways of your enemy. Live as they want you to. Win their trust. (beat) For with that, comes the way to escape. Suddenly, there's a WILD SCREECH from above! All Tharks l to see a MALAGOR circling and screaming! Two more join it their RIDERS shoot RED FLARES into the sky-- --as a LOUD KLAXON sounds, a warning cry throughout the c --as the ceremony falls apart! Tharks hurriedly race thro the streets, using mid-limbs as legs to resemble centaurs armed, armored and ready for--,  33.

dialogues.speaker: BATTLE STATIONS
dialogues.text: (Note: From this moment on, we perceive all language on M as Carter does -- as dialogue we can understand.) Tars mounts his own thoat and races into the fray. Carter trails Sola, who charges up a PLAZA STAIRCASE to see--

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: Hurry, Jonn-kata! From the skies! We are under attack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --several THARKS manning positions astride huge RADIUM CA launchers w/ gunner cockpits. Aiming skyward at--

dialogues.speaker: A GARGANTUAN AIRSHIP IN THE CLOUDS
dialogues.text: Descending from gray cirrus,.:the craft is a half-mile lo an open-deck like a great PIRATE SHIP! A dozen “FIGHTER” ESCORTS zip past it -- as a steady STROBE LIGHT blinks fr ship’s bow. BLACK SMOKE tails from its EIGHTH RAY ENGINES It's badly damaged... -..and in the streets, Tars Tarkas notices. His eyes narr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KLAXONS and MALAGORS scream on as Tal Hajus marches an ou corridor with COUNCILORS, as Tars finds him--

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: My King! It is a Helium ship! It signals for help!

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: It is a trap. Fire at will.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: We have not been attacked!

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: General Tarkas. Every second you doubt is a second Tharks die. Turn back the assault. (with venom) Kill everything on that ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On city rooftops, great GREEN BANNERS are snapped open, l signals to the Thark Malagor pilots above--  34. --who SOAR INTO BATTLE, gripping their mounted PULSE GUNS their Malagors SWOOP up to meet the Helium Fighters--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --while THARK MARKSMEN fire and the main airship is ROCKE Only now do the Helium forces return fire -- two FIGHTERS the city as RADIUM CANNONS on the main ship launch EMBER which spiral like catherine wheels, spitting WHITE SPARKS they hit the streets and DETONATE-- --COARSING down alleyways and into buildings, cutting dow Tharks in the plaza -- with a bolt ZIPPING right at Carte --just as an armed-to-the-teeth THARK races blindly past, the EMBER-FRAG rips him in two instead. Spared by fate, C picks up the fallen Thark’s rifle and runs on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Tars bounds to where FIXED ARTILLERY is perche tractor-trailer-sized CROSSBOWS with coils of rope cables Operators take aim on the mother craft--

dialogues.speaker: NORTH WALL
dialogues.text: --and huge STEEL GRAPPLES are shot into the sky, trailing taut cable -- and IMPALE the skin of the battleship! In m moments, a half-dozen cables have hold of the ship-- --and their cable coils start to retract. Like a whale harpooned, the great airship is pulled toward the city! I engines GLOW with heat, but it can’t escape the cables!

dialogues.speaker: ON A ADJACENT PARAPET
dialogues.text: Carter scampers to a high vantage, across an alley from T artillery post. Tars and co. are focused ahead, and don't notice a Helium FIGHTER soaring at them from behind-- --so Carter LEAPS to an unoccupied RADIUM CANNON, turning cockpit to take aim up-- --just as Tars spins to see Carter’s cannon aimed at him- --just as Carter SHOOTS a BLAST that whistles past Tars a SHATTERS the hull of the coming FIGHTER! The one-man flie WOBBLES, thrown off course... and Tars FIRES a second sho hitting the engine as the fighter EXPLODES! Tars nods a look of gratitude... then roars to his men:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the battle rages, the airship’s ENGINES and CANNONS ar obliterated. Like a hooked and netted fish, it’s hauled t the city’s broken dome, colliding below rooftops-- --and allowing cheering THARKS to drop onto the ship’s de Tars puts his rifle over a cable and SLIDES onto the ship descends into view for Carter-- -- see it TEE! with Hi -SIZED ENEMY S. ORS! The only difference is their RED SKIN. They shoot RIFLES and draw desperate SWORDS, suddenly desperately overmatched--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (astonished) They‘re human... --by the Tharks who SWARM their deck, cutting them down l right. Carter watches from the rooftop as Tars SLASHES hi through ten men all by himself... He stares as Tharks rid the airship of every RED MAN, hur bodies to the ground below. AND AT THE AIRSHIP‘S EDGE ENGINES FLARE as one HELIUM INTERCEPTOR craft TAKES OFF! an escape jet with a shrouded cockpit, bat-shaped and sle --it rockets skyward just as Tars spots its flight! He FI his rifle and just MISSES! The Interceptor SPARKS and SMO as it jets skyward, disappearing in the distance-- VAXX O.S. General Tarkas! Tars and Carter turn to see Vaxx drag from the ship a SQU FIGURE hidden by a rose-colored cloak. The captive elbows and slips past him... The Tharks LAUGH at the futility of escape attempt as the figure runs toward Carter who instinctively raises his sword to strike-- --as the figure‘'s cloak and hood fall away--

dialogues.speaker: TO REVEAL THE PRINCESS OF MARS
dialogues.text: A red-skinned, raven-haired woman, beautiful and strong, fine silks with a bare midriff, highlighted by a DIAMOND in a gold setting at her navel. This is DEJAH THORIS.  36. Carter stops in mid-strike, blade held high. It‘s an ange before him -- the most beautiful woman he's ever seen. An Dejah is just as confounded -- to see a man in Thark rega Astonished, Carter lowers the sword-- Behind him, Tars, Vaxx and a dozen THARK SOLDIERS have ar Dejah scampers up, trapped--

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: General Tarkas -- I'm here for you! Please listen to me! I've traveled to Thark for you! Tars motions to his soldiers. As they brusquely drag her she meets eyes with Carter. She gets only confusion, no g of sympathy. So her eyes harden -- and look away. Tars nods to Carter, with genuine respect. Then marches o his wake, Sola appears...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (still shell-shocked) Your enemy...they’re like me...

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: No, Jonn-kata. Not like you. {a proud smile) You are alive. As if on cue, EXPLOSIONS ring out from the huge battleshi hull, sending a FIREBALL of acrid smoke and flames into t framing Tars in a portrait of awesome destructive power. Consumed by the glee of brutal victory, the Tharks raise swords and fire rifles! And Carter can only watch... .-.-with both remorse and the fear of what's to come. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the clouds SHOOTS the second Helium Interceptor -- lone ship to escape Thark -~ soaring the sky toward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: above verdant green plains, where ZODANGAN AIRSHIPS and H AIRSHIPS are dueling the skies, trying to shift the front of what is clearly a massive war. The Interceptor nimbly dives and dodges low, above ZODANG GROUND TROOPS -- tens of thousands deep -- as they exchan volleys of LASER FIRE with HELIUM ARMED FORCES, holding t atop a ridge, beyond which lies--

dialogues.speaker: THE GLEAMING CITY OF HELIUM
dialogues.text: An awe-inspiring futuristic metropolis, made of hovering sections, in a crater valley of rivers and waterfalls. A FORCE SHIELD around the city flickers with ENERGY RIPPL it withstands enemy bombardment. Fully under siege. The Interceptor flies in, banks beneath a FLOATING PALACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and docks into position amidst HUNDREDS more. Its red Y PILOT hits the access catwalk, met by red OFFICERS:

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG PILOT
dialogues.text: The Princess is lost. INT. KING’S QUARTERS - DAY The King of Helium, TARDOS MORS, 60’s, great gravitas, si head bowed. Around his neck he wears a DIAMOND STONE, in royal crest mounting. The Young Pilot stands before him, flanked by HELIUM GENERALS.

dialogues.speaker: TARDOS MORS
dialogues.text: Do you know her fate?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG PILOT
dialogues.text: No, your Majesty. She was alive... The King raises his head, grieving done.

dialogues.speaker: TARDOS MORS
dialogues.text: Then there’s still a chance.

dialogues.speaker: HELIUM GENERAL
dialogues.text: It was madness, your Majesty. To place her hope in the Tharks-- Tardos Mors stands, using a silver cane. Steps to a windo overlook FORMAL GARDENS, where a HOLOGRAPHIC FIGURE in a stands amidst cherry blossom trees. Back turned.

dialogues.speaker: COURT ADVISER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sab Than is waiting, your Majesty. EXT. FORMAL GARDENS -— DAY The dark-cloaked HOLOGRAM is SAB THAN, the young Prince o Zodanga, 30. The lower half of his face is red-skinned, w Maori-like markings. The top half is shrouded by a HELMET  38. He watches the cherry blossoms fall around him, and indee through him, with a wistful sort of stare...

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN
dialogues.text: It's a tragedy, your Majesty, that a place of such beauty...must be destroyed in order to be saved.

dialogues.speaker: TARDOS MORS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The tragedy is to believe that. Sab Than’s hologram turns...to see Tardos Mors -- old and Yet his diamond pendant shines. Overhead, the city’s forc shields SHUDDER, absorbing enemy blasts.

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN
dialogues.text: You can’t survive. Surrender and you save the lives of millions.

dialogues.speaker: TARDOS MORS
dialogues.text: But not their future.

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN
dialogues.text: I was raised in the desert -- over one hundred years ago. Do you know what life is like there? A drop of rain, a blade of grass...they are all miracles. (beat) In time, this entire planet will be a desert. Its people will all need miracles. Why is Helium unwilling to try?

dialogues.speaker: TARDOS MORS
dialogues.text: We can share what resources we have. We can’t control nature.

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN
dialogues.text: But we can... This planet is dying! So you will deliver me the Atmosphere Plant or I will destroy your Kingdom to take it!

dialogues.speaker: TARDOS MORS
dialogues.text: It can’t be controlled. It can only be protected. If you try to override the Plant, it will destroy us all!

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN
dialogues.text: According to you!

dialogues.speaker: TARDOS MORS
dialogues.text: According to those much wiser than me.  39.

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN
dialogues.text: I offer the people a miracle. I've won their hearts and minds. What do you have to offer them?

dialogues.speaker: TARDOS MORS
dialogues.text: Peace. Sab Than’s hologram stares darkly.

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN
dialogues.text: There is peace in death, your Majesty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HOLOGRAM of Tardos Mors VANISHES...as angle reveals SAB in the flesh, turning to a window overlook--

dialogues.speaker: OF THE CITY OF ZODANGA
dialogues.text: A TOWERING METROPOLIS OF DARK METAL ISLANDS among smog- c Each islarid*is supported by massive stilts. It’s a jungl of Soviet-style architecture -- slums upon slums, like a blackened scab upon the sky’s foul soot blanket. Giant ZODANGAN AIRSHIPS are sky-docked at platforms, with SOLDIERS scurrying to re-arm and re-supply. It is clearly well-oiled war machine...as Sab Than turns to a GENERAL:

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN
dialogues.text: No mercy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doors THUNDER OPEN to reveal a court-like rotunda. Eight THARKS, the War Council, flank a central pulpit -- where Hajus slumps in a lazy, draconian pose. Carter slips in, desperate to find the princess. An assem THARK OFFICERS watches as Dejah is brought before Hajus. fore are Tars, Vaxx and Sarkoja.

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: Princess of Helium. How unexpected. To what do we owe the hostilities? Despite the environs, she’s far from intimidated:

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Commander Hajus, I demand the safe treatment of my ship’s prisoners--

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: What prisoners?  40.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: (pure bitterness) You’re even more savage than your reputation.

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: And you more beautiful. Enough compliments.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: We were a damaged vessel requesting safe harbor. We returned fire only when provoked--

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: Lack of wisdom in red men surprises no Thark. The Thark audience laughs. Dejah sees Tars Tarkas doesn't

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: We were engaged -by Zodangan warships over the Korus Hills. Mine was a diplomatic mission. My destination was Thark. There’s a MURMUR of surprise among the assembled Tharks. Hajus narrows his eyes as the murmur grows...

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: For decades, we have maintained the entire planet’s water supply, despite the brutal interference of your Tharks. You know that if not for our scientific operations, there wouldn’t be the resources on Mars to support a single life -- green or red. Hajus scowls, but doesn't dispute this.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Within days, my city will fall. only an alliance will save us both--

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: Your war with Zodanga is not Thark concern.

dialogues.speaker: DEJA
dialogues.text: Sab Than wants the Atmosphere Plant. He intends to override it. Another MURMUR in the audience...this one of worry...  41.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: It provides our air, our water, our existence. It has run itself since the dawn of time! Is that for one man to control? If it even can be controlled? Hajus gives a dismissive wave. Dejah meets the gaze of Ta Tarkas...and now turns toward him...

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: That Plant was a gift from the Orovars, the creators -- beyond our science and understanding. My people have sworn to protect it~-

dialogues.speaker: SARKOJA
dialogues.text: You will addressss Commander Hajusss!

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: I address all Tharks.

dialogues.speaker: SARKOJA
dialogues.text: Ssstrike her! Ssstrike her down!

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: (pleads with Tars) I promise you, this is your fight. Tharks once knew the meaning of honor. You were more than thieves and killers - - until this King--

dialogues.speaker: STRIKE HER DOWN
dialogues.text: It's Vaxx who heeds the command. He charges Dejah and BAC her to the floor! Her navel's DIAMOND STONE is again reve as Vaxx is upon her, raising his sword-- --only to have it PARRIED aside with a CRASH of metal tha the blade flying from his hands!-- --as Vaxx spins to see Carter standing there. Sword ready

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Try again and I'll kill you. The entire council GASPS -- hearing Carter speak their la Even Tars looks astonished.

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: He speaks...? Our language?  42. The entire room of Tharks now STANDS, drawing WEAPONS. Bu Carter stands his ground as Dejah raises herself on one e watching with wide, staring eyes.

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: Take the Earth Man away! He has no right in this War Council!

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: But he does, my King. He is the Thark who captured her. He has the right to name her fate.

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: The Earth Man?!

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: It is the law. Another MURMUR as all wait to see Hajus’ reaction...

dialogues.speaker: VAXX, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: This is a Thark? Then let him die like a Thark-- Carter looks up to see -- BAM! -- Vaxx's four hands SHOVE backwards. Vaxx calls to all assembled:

dialogues.speaker: VAXX
dialogues.text: I demand Justice}! Carter doesn’t know what's happening. Tars now looks grim does Dejah, now held captive by Sarkoja...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: “Justice,” what’s “justice”...

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: You have been challenged, Jonn-kata. Vaxx takes a sudden step toward him -- so Carter spins, p both his DAGGER-SWORDS defensively--

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: The weapon is chosen. Vaxx nods smugly. And draws his own daggers -- four of th

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What is this? For what?

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: For honor, Jonn-kata. From this moment on, only one of you may live.  43. Carter meets Dejah's eyes. He’s in this for her...

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: I wonder, princess. How many fools have gone to their deaths...over you? And Vaxx CHARGES! Lunging with all FOUR DAGGERS, whipping wildly. Carter PARRIES two blows, but a third CLANKS off armor and a fourth SLASHES his side! Carter buckles to a as Vaxx brings his two free arms SLASHING DOWN-- --and Carter dive-rolls forward -- through Vaxx's legs -- nick of time. He looks up to see Vaxx charge again-- --but this time Carter drops into a fighting stance, both ready. He backs up, PARRYING a succession of four blows - when Vaxx swings them in pairs-- --Carter ducks the two high strikes and PARRIES the two l Vaxx brings the high arms slashing down and Carter parrie those. When the low arms strike from the side-- --Carter forcibly splits the held high blades, leaping up FORWARD FLIP and landing a SLASH to Vaxx'’s shoulder. Blo spurts and the Thark buckles! The Thark audience REACTS as Carter lands in a ready crou Vaxx spins, PIROUETTING TWO BLADES at him-- --and just as they’re about to ROTOR into Carter's face, flashes his daggers up, KNOCKING them harmlessly aside. V extra daggers skitter into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: AND VAXX TAKES A ROARING, RUNNING LEAP
dialogues.text: As Carter dive-rolls forward, letting Vaxx land beyond hi struggles up -- but Vaxx is there! He barely PARRIES a bl only to have Vaxx PUNCH him in the gut. Vaxx SLICES his second blade -- Carter ducks away, but an fist BACKHANDS him to the floor. He loses a dagger. Vaxx has too many arms for Carter to defend-- --as Vaxx stalks forth, grinning, toying with him now. Wo badly, Carter struggles to crawl away, trying to reach hi fallen dagger--

dialogues.speaker: VAXX
dialogues.text: When you choose your weapon, Earth Man...next time, choose a gun... And as Vaxx slashes down CROSSED DAGGERS for the final bl Carter HURLS HIS LAST DAGGER like a point-blank javelin - the same strength he'd thrown the Martian rock!  44. THUNK! Time seems to stop. Vaxx stands stock-still...as a trickle of blood runs from his lips. His crossed daggers still held at his chest--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Next time. --pinned there by Carter's DAGGER, which has run right th Vaxx's wrists and impaled his heart. Vaxx hits the floor, dead. The Tharks are astonished. So Dejah. As Carter wearily stands...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You say I name the princess’ fate? Tars looks to Hajus, who grudgingly nods.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Then I say she lives.

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: (a defiant sneer) Then live you shall, Princess. While we determine just what you are worth. And to whom. With a POUND of his staff, the Council is dismissed. Haju to Sarkoja, who hauls Dejah away. The Thark officers POUN their own sword-hilts on the ground -- a war-like drumbea Dejah and Carter lock eyes... ++-as she’s pulled out of sight. The Thark officers keep DRUMBEAT. It’s like they're saluting...him.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: (to Carter) Come with me. INT. VAXX'S QUARTER’S - PALACE - NIGHT Tars leads Carter, Sola and Woola into a well-furnished r

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Your mastery of our weapons was expected. Your mastery of our language was not. (a beat) You are an interesting man, Jonn-kata.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Call me John.  4s. Before Carter can ask why, squires enter carrying the clo armor, and weapons of Vaxx.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: This is now yours.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (re: Vaxx‘’s possessions) Shouldn’t this be left to his family?

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: (laughs) You still have much to learn about Tharks. Tars and Carter sit at a table as Vaxx's squires bring pl strange fruit and vegetables.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Eat. Woola comes sniffing for table scraps. Carter tosses him Martian rodent, pats his flanks:

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Run along, Woola. It’s all right. The calot plops his belly on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: “Woola.” Why?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Just something we do back home.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: You command the calot as you do the thoats -~ without force. It is an interesting tactic. Tars studies Carter, eyeing the sword in his hilt.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: And you use your sword in a most intriguing way... Tars stands and imitates Carter's fighting moves, but the actions are clumsy. Carter rises and pulls his sword...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You're lunging too quick...  46. Carter demonstrates a more elegant approach. With an exce student's observational skill, Tars repeats the action wi fluidity.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Good. Feeling high-spirited, Tars moves to a weapons rack and a his other three hands mace, ax, and shield.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: I use this when I’m surrounded... With a magnificent display of skill, Tars uses each limb equal dexterity against an assault by invisible opponents Stopping, he offers the weapons to Carter...

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: You try. Carter hold up his hands - “Only two arms."

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Sorry. Carter breaks a smile. Tars laughs, returns the weapons t rack and gestures with his two free arms...

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Grow two more and I will make you Captain of the Guard. Carter and Tars laugh.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Where did you learn to fight?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: West Point. A military academy...

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: +.. Where they train in the way of the warrior... It was taught to me from the moment I hatched. (with some regret) It is all we learn. Dismissing any temptation to be introspective, Tars leans toward more “upbeat” subjects...

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Perhaps... Perhaps it is well that you found your way to Barsoom.  47. Carter smiles, but he's not sure.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (gnawing at him) I must ask you, Tars, about the princess. What will become of her? Tars reaches for his stein, but cannot bring himself to d The joy has vanished. From the shadows, Sola listens in..

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) Tal Hajus will not honor her request for an alliance. Instead he will sell her to the prince of Zodanga.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: So she came to you for help.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Yes. Because Tharks should respect-: honor. Yet honor means nothing to Tal Hajus.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What will Tal Hajus do?

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: He will... Our King, he... He will “keep” her before turning her over to Zondanga. .

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: “Keep?”

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: He has a “taste” for red women. His decadence knows no bounds... Carter is stunned, saddened, appalled, and quietly furiou Desperate to change the subject, Tars rises...

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Let me show you my rifles!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (polite) Tars... I’ma little tired... If you'll excuse me, I’ll say good night. Tars knows that he has lost a degree of Carter’s respect, replies with equal politeness...  48.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: As you wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIERY TORCHES light the gutted, looted Helium battleship, HUNDREDS OF THARKS cut free its tethers. But rather than to the ground, it instead floats higher. Like a great bli the behemoth ascends into the sky-- --as the FIRE spreads within it. Against a star-scape bac it lights up like a FUNERAL PYRE, billowing black smoke a flame. Rising to join the galaxy beyond... EXT./INT. CARTER’S BALCONY - SAME ...as Carter watches from his balcony, lost in thought. H turns to see Sola and Woola approach, watching the sky wi In a far part of the palace is a LIGHTED ROOM in a HIGH T Carter analyzes ledges and other old balconies. Sola poin Malagors patrolling the sky...

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: They watch the sky for Helium airships...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Then they won't be looking for me. (to Woola) Stay. Concerned, Sola watches Carter JUMP thirty feet to the NE LEDGE... Mortar gives way and bricks drop to the street alerting the Malagors! Carter quickly pulls himself up, h from view as the Malagors soar past. INT. DEJAH’S ROOM - PALACE - NIGHT Dejah watches the burning FUNERAL PYRE, tears fill her ey her lost ship drifts to the heavens. Alone, Dejah begins disrobe, but stops when she hears... CARTER O.S. Princess... She spins and covers herself, drying her tears. For a mom neither says a word, both acutely aware of a subtle yet i mutual attraction...  49.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: There are four guards. Right outside.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Then send for them. He waits. She hesitates. And curiosity gets the best of h

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: (with suspicion) Who are you? -

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: My name is John Carter. I'm a prisoner here as well.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: You attacked my ship and killed my men.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I thought you were my enemy.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
