dialogues.text: And now you think differently? (beat) Yet you live among Tharks, you wear their armor, you speak their language. He points to the starscape beyond the balcony:

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’m from Earth. The future. I’m here by mistake. We were lost in a cave -- a friend and I -- and we ended up here. All I want is to find him and return home. Have you seen or heard of a man like me?

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: No. A weighted beat between them.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: You believe there is a way back.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: That cave was a portal. It was built - - by an intelligence--

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: The Orovars. (off his look) They were the ancestors of all life. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEJAH (cont'd) They traveled the galaxies, colonizing planets. They built the Atmosphere Plant that makes Mars inhabitable, they built our canals, our cities -~ and then vanished a million years ago. If there’s a portal on Earth...I suspect they built your planet too. Dejah goes to the window, where Earth hangs in the night

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: You say you‘re from the future? Carter nods.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Does life on this planet survive? Carter hesitates. She waits with troubled eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yeah. .Yeah it does... She smiles, emboldened.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: This is why we fight.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What will happen to you?

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Tal Hajus will keep me prisoner. Red men are all the same to him. He blames us all for his people's exile.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: And if I were to help you? She looks up, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Would you help me in return? Your kingdom has ships, communications... to help me search for my friend. Dejah studies his gallant face...with a newfound hope...

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Beyond this city lie oceans of desert - - full of Warhoons and worse. It will take days to get to Helium...if it even still stands.  51.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’1l take the chance.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: And if he’s dead? If you never find him?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I'll have tried. She searches his eyes, trying to allay last suspicions...

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Then tell me, John Carter. How do we escape ten thousand Tharks? Their whispering faces are close enough to kiss...there's charge in the air...but Carter remains focused:

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: By deciding to leave. Carter backs into the shadows, and with one last look, disappears over the side of the balcony... as Dejah turns to the window and allows a troubled smile.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: John Carter. Of Earth. +.-and as she looks to the stars, ANGLE moves past her to hidden GRATE in the high shadows of the ceiling. From a r perch above...a pair of THARK EYES gleam... Sarkoja has been watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More WARSHIPS rumble as they detach from their docking sp heading into the black and murky cloudscape...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sab Than marches the bridge level, flanked by GENERALS--

dialogues.speaker: ZODANGAN GENERAL
dialogues.text: Lord Prince, we've intercepted a communication from Helium-- --as they arrive at a COMMUNICATIONS CONSOLE. An INTELLIG OFFICER reads a decoded message:  52.

dialogues.speaker: INTEL OFFICER
dialogues.text: "King of Thark, I request the safe return of the Princess. Reward will be yours at any price.”

dialogues.speaker: ZODANGAN GENERAL
dialogues.text: It was coded with a royal frequency.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND GENERAL
dialogues.text: How could the Tharks have taken her prisoner?

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN
dialogues.text: If she's there, she went willingly. For an alliance. Sab Than stares at HOLOGRAM SCREENS charting the progress armies’ assault on Helium...

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN
dialogues.text: And if she’s there...so is the key.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND GENERAL
dialogues.text: We'll redeploy our warships. We'll surround Thark and take her ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN
dialogues.text: Our ships can’t be spared. Sab Than nods to his SENIOR AIDES, silently in his shadow

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN
dialogues.text: Ready my armor and my ship. (to his Generals) This is the turning point. (darkly) Leave the princess to me. INT. CARTER’S ROOM - NIGHT Late, silent. Embers in the fire. Woola snores, slumberin the foot of the bed...as a SHADOW slips past. It’s Carter With a farewell look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter ghosts down the stairs and into the corridor. But sensing a presence, he grabs his sword and spins-- --to see Woola on the bottom step. Sitting. Panting.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Perfect.  53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two SENTRY THARKS patrol past, as Carter darts across the in their wake, keeping to shadows. Woola scampers right b as Carter glares:

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You're not coming! Go home, get outta here. Go! Woola doesn't. So Carter points his sword -- a threat:

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You stink and you're ugly but it was very nice meeting you. Now go slobber on somebody else. The beast whimpers with mournful eyes...but finally slink Carter sheathes his sword and looks skyward. With a LEAP. on the rooftops. Woola immediately turns tail and races the way they came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woola bursts in, chuffing and nuzzling Sola’s sleeping fa shoots awake -- and sees Carter’s empty bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter scampers the rooftops, under cover of darkness. A perch gives him a vantage of the Palace Tower-- --where a LIGHT is on in Dejah’s high window. A high ston corridor bridges it to the rest of the palace, but the to also ringed by a crumbling outer staircase -- beginning h up. Directly beneath it is a thatched-roof GUARDHOUSE, wi small CAMPFIRE. And two SENTRY THARKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sentries cross paths, then separate, allowing Carter through the shadows between them, planting a foot off a s box and LEAPING HIGH-~- --to grab the lowest crumbling stair! He pulls himself up

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Close. --and suddenly the STONE breaks apart beneath his weight! hands scrape the stairs, coming up empty, eyes wide--  54. --and he FALLS straight back down! SMASH! He punches a ho through the straw guardhouse roof, glancing off HAY BALES THUMP! Hits the ground on his back--

dialogues.speaker: AS A CREATURE'S GIANT EYE
dialogues.text: opens right behind him. A staring pupil, the size of Cart entire head. At a SNORT, Carter slowly turns...

dialogues.speaker: THARK GUARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I heard something! By the tower! +..to see a slumbering MALAGOR wake. The shack is his hom dragon-like head rises, wings unfurling-- --and Carter swiftly looks to the CAMPFIRE beyond the doo its burning logs within reach. With an idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sentry Tharks come running just as the straw-roofed h GOES UP IN FLAMES! And in the next instant -- SMASH! The panicked Malagor CRASHES straight through the burning roo FLAPPING WINGS skyward, elevating straight up-- --with Carter perched on its back! Skying a pure vertical --he comes even with the tower's stairs and jumps off. He crouches in shadow, unseen by the guards below-- --as the Malagor pumps its wings, shrieks, and flies off, snuffing last bits of flame from its wing-tips. The Sentr try to smother the mysterious stable-fire...while Carter scampers a spiral to the high window. INT. DEJAH‘S ROOM Carter slips inside, seeing Dejah’s figure asleep beneath covers. He races to the bed-- .

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: It's time to leave, Princess-- But the bed is empty.

dialogues.speaker: SOLA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: She is gone... Carter wheels to see Sola step into the light, waiting fo

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: You didn’t say goodbye, Jonn-kata.  55.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Sola rush out to see two THARK GUARDS lying de felled by radium gunfire. Carter’s still astonished:

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You did this? These are your people...

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: They were, a long time ago. And now they know of your plans. Tal Hajus hoped you would seek to escape. It gives him a reason to take your life.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: You stood up against him -- in the Council. You remind us it is possible. She wears a look of pride...and remains resolute...

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: You won't survive the desert, Jonn- kata. Not alone.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: That seems to be the general consensus. She offers him her pistol. Carter takes it and nods.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Take me to her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a ledge above, a FIXED TENT sits beside two RADIUM CAN buffeted by a gale. A guarded checkpoint. Two THARKS stand by their post when they hear a DISTANT W Immediately, they rush to their gunner positions-- --as they and their cannons are OBLITERATED in a STRAFING RADIUM FIRE as a Zodangan FIGHTER (with tail-mounted cann SOARS past, right through the pass.  56.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIGHTER
dialogues.text: Is piloted by Sab Than. His metallic mask consults a blin target-screen, with a map of the city of Thark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the city in the b.g. as ENGINES ROAR...and the shi low, hovering over the sands. A HATCH swivels open and a CARGO DISC lowers, carrying Sa mounted on an ARMORED THOAT. As they reach the sand-- --Sab Than spurs his mount and rides off. For the dark ci Sab Than gallops the midnight sand...and as he does, his BLENDS with his surroundings, cloaking him again as a HEA MIRAGE SHIMMER. A trick of the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three GATE SENTRIES tense at the sound of hoofbeats. They weapons, pointing them into the dark desert... ...aS a HEAT-MIRAGE of a THOAT charges forth, cantering t halt in a swirl of dust. The Sentries hold fire--

dialogues.speaker: GATE SENTRIES
dialogues.text: There‘s no one there--! --and don’t notice Sab Than’s HEAT-MIRAGE leap over the T to land right behind them. They spin at the sound-- --as a SWORD-MIRAGE cuts two of them down in an instant! third sentry scampers back, waving a sword defensively-~ --as a SWORDPOINT-MIRAGE plunges out of his chest. The Th falls to his knees, as Sab Than’s MIRAGE is at his ear:

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN
dialogues.text: Open the gates. INT. TAL HAJUS’ BEDCHAMBER - NIGHT In an opulent room that reeks of cruel carnality...stands tense Dejah. Chained to a post is a fierce BANTH, a ten- Martian “tiger.” Doors THUNDER open as Tal Hajus enters w Sarkoja, who greets the Banth like a kitten...

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: That's a sweet little girl. To think she once despised me...  57.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: I find that hard to believe. Hajus rubs the thing’s belly and it purrs.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Why was I moved from my room...

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: Moved? You escaped with the Earth Man. Why you may never be found. Dejah tenses, with Sarkoja now circling behind her...

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: What are you hiding, Princess?

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: I have no idea what you’re--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your “kingdom says’ they'll pay any reward I name. Who would be worth that...amidst a war? Not one life. Not even a princess. (slyly) Only what she has. Or what she knows.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: You are mistaken. Hajus merely nods, leaving the Banth...

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: You reds with your scientific prowess, your knowledge, your secrets. What have you ever shared with my people? The princess backs away...

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: You think of us as savages. But let me ask you: when the last lakes dry up, when the winter rains cease...what will any of us be but savages? (beat) And the ones who survive...will be the ones who are best at it. Dejah watches Sarkoja pour a decanter of WINE. It‘s fille long and slithering MAGGOT-WORMS...  58.

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: You will tell me what you are hiding, Princess. Or you will beg for the mercy of a death that may never come.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: But they’1l pay...my people will pay...

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: Yes they will. And you are the price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Sola press to a corner, peering to view a GRAN STAIRCASE filled with dozens of Palace THARKS-~-

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: His chambers are above.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Any other way in? Sola shakes her head. Carter grips his pistol:

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Wish me luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THARK SOLDIERS arrive to see the gates wide open and the Sentries slain. They burst into action, sending the alarm

dialogues.speaker: THARK SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: Intruders in the city! INTRUDERS! --as, far beyond the gates, Sab Than’s HEAT-MIRAGE marche on...as a phalanx of THARKS race right by him, unaware. Atop the city walls, Tars Tarkas and Major Jakkal arrive scene. Tars stares into the dark desert...seeing the HEAT MIRAGE of a thoat. He whips up his rifle and FIRES-- --as a GREEN PULSE-BOLT strikes the steed, lighting it up materializing it as it topples. To Jakkal:

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: (gravely) The warlord is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Carter prepares to charge -- a KLAXON sounds. The Pala THARKS race into action, grabbing weapons and hurrying to the entrances. They disperse from the stairs--  59. --as Carter and Sola trade a look at their sudden fortune

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: I wished you luck. INT. TAL HAJUS’ BEDCHAMBER Tal Hajus, Sarkoja and Dejah ail react to the outer ALARM keeps backing Dejah toward the bed...

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: Seems your Earth Man‘s been found. Why don‘t you try your charms on me? Suddenly, Dejah CHARGES him -- darting for the door -- bu of his claws HURL her back to the bed, cutting her-- --and at the sight of Dejah’s bleeding wound, the worms i wine grow more and more frenzied...

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: Have you never known Issla worms, princess? They enter your bloodstream through an open wound -- and then breed. The pain is said to be unbearable. Their secretions slow your blood loss, so that torture that would kill you in minutes lasts for days. Dejah tries to cover her forearm, dripping red...

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: And time means so very little...in the desert... And with a smile, he suddenly SNATCHES her by the throat-

dialogues.speaker: AS THE DOOR SMASHES OPEN
dialogues.text: --as a THARK GUARD comes crashing right through it! Carte bursts on scene, FIRING his radium pistols! Sola lays dow COVER FIRE with Guards outside-- --as Tal Hajus and Sarkoja dive low, GREEN PULSE-BOLTS ricocheting around them. Sarkoja drops the glass decanter --as ISSLA WORMS spill out with the liquid, wriggling acr sheets for Dejah with high-pitched SQUEALS! She scrambles tumbling off--  60. --as Carter's pistol clicks dry, “recharging.” He draws a dagger-sword with a RUNNING LEAP -- and lands just as Tal rises, planting both boots in the King's jaw! Behind him, Sarkoja draws KNIVES just as Dejah grabs the decanter -- and SMASHES it across Sarkoja’s face! Sarkoja the floor, writhing, blinded by glass cuts-- --and she doesn’t see the ISSLA WORMS cascade off the bed scenting blood...as the worms wriggle en masse into Sarko facial WOUNDS! She convulses with horrified screams! Carter lifts Dejah from the ground-- --just as TWO DAGGERS spring from Hajus‘’ bracelets, like switchblades, hidden by the backs of his hands-- --and he drives both BLADES deep into Carter’s side! Bloo gushes! Carter reels, badly wounded-- Tal Hajus laughs and begins to rise... --as Carter recovers enough to FLY AT Hajus with a huge s his fist! BAM! The King goes down. Bleeding badly, Carter grabs Dejah:

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Time to leave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wounded Carter and Dejah race through the shadows, as A and COMMOTION sound all around them. Behind them we see shimmers of LIGHT from the TORCHES of Guards... Up ahead is what looks like an opening to the P outside the palace... SCRAAAAAPE! POUND-POUND-POUND! Cart and Dejah stop. SCRAAAAAPE! POUND-POUND-POUND! A SHAPE appears...! It is Woola. Wearing a collar and chain, dragging a large he pulled from the wall to which he was tethered. Carter wraps his arms around the calot and the happy beas a familiar “Oola-oola-oola.” Carter SMASHES free the coll lock with the hilt of his sword.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: I take it he’s yours.  61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --as Tars Tarkas rides on scene, surveying the chaos--

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Hold positions! Close the gates! --as Palace Guards reverse course, hurrying back through open palace entry. And now Tars alone sees-- ~-a HEAT-MIRAGE of Sab Than’s figure storming invisibly a them, about to gain access to the grounds! With a BELLOW-

dialogues.speaker: THIS PALACE
dialogues.text: --the Tharks all freeze, seeing Tars instantly HURL his s It GRAZES the heat-mirage--

dialogues.speaker: AS SAB THAN MATERIALIZES AMIDST THIRTY THARKS
dialogues.text: sword poised, braced for battle. Locking eyes with Tars. Sab Than moves with a controlled elegance as his blade sl the air, killing a dozen Tharks as he marches forward-- --as two dying Tharks manage to get the gate shut as thei acts of courage...only to have Sab Than fire his PROPULSI and sail right over it. Landing on palace grounds. Sab Than looks back at Tars Tarkas and his remaining sold

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN
dialogues.text: Tell your King I'm‘here. Then calmly marches inside. In the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! Doors blow open as Carter, Dejah and Woola race in- --as Carter rushes to the BLACK-EYED THOAT he'd “tamed.” Suddenly, someone approaches! Carter grips his sword and to see... Sola, a SPEAR in hand, poised for launch... Car freezes. Sola THROWS the spear! It sails past him and HIT GUARD coming at them from behind!

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: Quickly, we must go.  62.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: We?

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: I can stay in Thark no longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Thoats GALLOP into the streets, with Sola on one and and Dejah clinging to the reins of Black-Eyes. Woola skeddaddles wildly to catch up... «..as they race their thoats into a warren of alleys. But every direction they turn, PLATOONS OF THARKS are converg --leaving them backed to a MOSQUE-LIKE BUILDING. Perhaps house of worship. With no choice, they rush inside--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and find themselves in a mangy ZITIDAR CORRAL, where te ZITIDARS (the Tharks' mastodon-like cargo haulers) munch bramble and ivy -- eyeing the-tiny intruders.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Aim high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pursuing Tharks converge on the building as GREEN RAD FIRE lights up from within and there’s a RUMBLE as-- KABOOM! The ten zitidars EXPLODE through the doors, stamp to escape like a herd of panicked elephants! They crush T and thoats alike as they funnel into the alleys-- --and send the stream of oncoming Tharks into retreat, re course in a mad dash to get out of their way! In the chaos, Carter, Dejah, Sola and Woola ride out a si of the building. Escaping unseen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars rides on scene, surveying the searching SOLDIERS--

dialogues.speaker: THARK SOLDIER
dialogues.text: The prisoners were here, General. They ride with a Thark!

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: What Thark?  63. INT. TOWER CORRIDOR/DEJAH‘S QUARTERS - SAME BOOM! Sab Than storms the hall to Dejah’s old quarters -- passing the fallen guards Sola and Carter killed. In her he sees the remnants of Dejah's stay... ...and then hears shouts from outside. He storms to the n window. From the tower vantage, he spots the escaping tho and-riders nearing a fountain square...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALARMS and SHOUTS still blare as our heroes reach the cor a seemingly empty square, with a HUGE, ORNATE FOUNTAIN in center. Bone-dry and empty.

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: The fountain leads to the canals. Inside. Hurry. (off Dejah’s look) You must trust me. Sola spurs her mount and gallops it across the open squar LEAPING the edge of the fountain-- --and landing in its recessed base. Twenty feet below gro it REVEALS its basin extends below the fountain’s rim. In darkness -- underground. Carter and Dejah trade a look to see Sola disappear--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Hang on. --and as Dejah wraps arms tight around him, Carter spurs mount, galloping into the open-- AS A RIFLE’S POV NOW SIGHTS THEM --from high above, where Sab Than is perched on the tower balcony with his own radium rifle -- as he FIRES!

dialogues.speaker: AND A BLUE PULSE-BOLT RIPS RIGHT AT
dialogues.text: Carter and Dejah, just as Woola sees and leaps to protect And takes the BOLT in his side! Woola falls in a flash of FLAME. Black-Eyes the thoat skids, sending Carter and Dej thrown to the ground--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Woola!  64. --and as they scramble up, Sab Than reacts to Carter’s fa red, not green. Who is that? Woola’s fallen...he convulse BLUE CRACKLING ENERGY...as he meets Carter's eyes...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Thank you, my friend... Reluctantly, Carter and Dejah leap over the fountain’s si join Sola and scramble back aboard Black-Eyes--

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: Ride! Ride!

dialogues.speaker: WHILE ON THE TOWER BALCONY
dialogues.text: Sab Than reloads his rifle and sights -- but too late. Th all vanished from view, underground. The warlord lowers h rifle...with a troubled stare...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The.two thoats descend sandstone steps.. Sola lights PHOS FLARES. Carter's wracked with pain; Dejah holds him.

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: They've been dry for generations, but they lead beyond the city walls. 7 --and as they round the steps, the tunnel opens onto a ma CANAL CAVERN, an aqueduct that once transported water for millions. In crumbling disrepair, but still intact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Canal spills into a DRY RIVERBED. Reaching the end of tunnel, Sola and Dejah crawl out of the Canal and climb t ridge... Lagging behind, Carter follows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rising from the riverbed, a relieved Carter turns to Deja Sola who look like they just received a death sentence. Carter spins... Sitting atop a panting thoat is Tars Tark In each hand he holds a rifle. Two are pointed at Sola an Dejah. He aims the Third at Carter. Dispirited, overcome pain, Carter drops to his knees, hangs his head, and rais arms in surrender.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Jonn-kata. -~  65. A beaten Carter looks up... Tars throws him the rifle and gestures at the TWO THOATS.

dialogues.speaker: TARS_-TARKAS
dialogues.text: (with regret) . You ride with them, Sola? Terribly torn, Sola fights back tears and nods. Coolly, f tosses two rifles to her and the last to the princess.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Travel north to the Warhoon border. In two days, double back to the Ishkee Valley - it is a safe route to Helium. I will tell them your tracks lead south. Overwhelmed, Carter tries to thank him..

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Tars...

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Say nothing. If ever I see you again... You will die by my hand. A stoic Tars kicks his thoat and returns to the city. INT. TAL HAJUS’ BEDCHAMBER - NIGHT ANGLE TRACKS past fallen guards and Sarkoja’s worm-ravage corpse...to find Tal Hajus. As his eyes crack open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KER-CHUK! Doors crash open as Tal Hajus STORMS in, oblivi his wounds. Thark SERVANTS scamper in tow-- _

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: --and stops short. Standing on the map dais, hands claspe back turned...is Sab Than. Scared THARK ELDERS wait...

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN
dialogues.text: Tal Hajus. You were in possession of the Princess of Helium. And you chose not to inform Zodanga.

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: I was on the verge -- of sending word--  66.

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN
dialogues.text: That you had her? Or that you let her escape? Sab Than now turns. Tal Hajus takes an instinctive step b as Tars Tarkas arrives in the doorway behind him.

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: Lord Prince--? *y

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN
dialogues.text: The one who rides with her.

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: He claims to come from Earth. We captured him many months ago -- in the Paktar Sea Beds.

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN
dialogues.text: And you let him live?

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: (a glare to Tars) We thought he had worth as a warrior. He is without your technology or skill, but he has power. The Prince of Zodanga marches forth. Hajus tenses...

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN
dialogues.text: Your people exist at my pleasure. When the war is over, you should wish to be remembered well.

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: We will find her, Lord Prince--

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN
dialogues.text: Yes you will. (beat) Or you'll find extinction. Hajus reluctantly lowers a knee, bowing, and Sab Than str past. His armor DE-MATERIALIZES, turning him into a vanis HEAT-MIRAGE at the door. Gone. In his wake, Hajus rises. Stares daggers at Tars Tarkas.  67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind WHIPS fiercely as A BLOOD RED SUN rises over an endl sandscape. Dunes to the horizon. In the distance, two tin THOATS trudge the sand. An injured Carter slumps behind D deathly weak...

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: (to Sola) He's losing too much blood...

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: There is no help in the desert. Let us ride without rest for the Saravak Pass. And pray. Sola looks behind them, we can see the faint lights of Th miles distant across the angry desert night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MALAGOR with a THARK RIDER swoops over the desert, scou for signs of them as it flies over a ragged ribbon of tre an exposed aqueduct, ceiling collapsed and long gone ary. It soars on, over a contingent of Thark SOLDIERS on THOAT by Tars Tarkas. A pack of TRACKING CALOTS lead them on... pounding, following Carter’s trail...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fierce SANDSTORM rages as Sola urges her thoat against gale. Suddenly, a feverish Carter FALLS! Dejah drops to h side. He's wracked with sweat and shivering, eyes shut...

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: Sola scrambles over, feeling his breaths rise and fall. S inspects his bandaged wound and then spots some scrub-pla thorn bushes in the sand, battered by the gale--

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: Stay with him. Give him shelter. And keep him awake. Sola then forges ahead into the sandstorm -- all alone.  68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A makeshift tent has been put up, with Carter and Dejah i huddled against the elements. Dejah brings a canteen of w to his lips... ...and sees, around his neck, his Army DOG TAGS. She reac for them, tentative. Wipes the grime away to read his nam

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (delirious, slurred) I want to tell you the truth... She startles, releases his tags. His breath is ragged...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: The truth...about the future...

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: This planet doesn’t survive. Dejah trembles, unwilling to believe it. Carter nods.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: The Barsoom I’ve known...has no life. You won't win your fight. (winces, shuts eyes) I’m sorry... Dejah edges back. Then grows resolute:

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: It's the future of all planets, isn’t it? Yours too. So do you stop fighting for your survival today?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER -
dialogues.text: Come with me... She's surprised. His mind is drifting, delirium near...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: To Earth... (with reverence) There‘s all the water you could ever dream of. Rivers...oceans...

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: And is there no war? Carter falls silent.  69.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: That is the world I dream of. They trade a solemn look. Carter's fading fast...and as h loses consciousness, she tenses, clutching him--

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: No...stay awake...stay awake... --and, without other recourse, presses her lips to his an kisses him. She holds it...but when she looks back...his are shut. She takes his hand, feeling his pulse... He’s still alive. She then sees his NOTEBOOK poking from pocket. She opens it up to the first page: “My name is Ca John Carter, United States Army, etc.”

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I fought today alongside Tharks. I killed men who were strangers for a cause I don't understand or believe in. How it reminded me of home... Still holding his hand as the tent buffets from the storm outside...she settles in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Dejah continues to read his journal...as the DIAMON at her navel gleams in the dim light...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: I write tonight not knowing if these words will be my last. A princess of Mars has asked me to help her. And in return, she says she‘ll help me. I’ve no idea if she’s telling the truth. But I have no one else to trust...

dialogues.speaker: SOLA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Princess?! The tent flap OPENS SUDDENLY as Sola peers in, with armfu cactus branches and an excited look:

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: The storm has lifted. Dejah emerges...to see that MOUNTAIN FOOTHILLS now loom n They've crossed the desert!  70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CAMPFIRE crackles as Sola roasts an avian carcass, whil thoats munch on bramble. Meanwhile, Dejah spreads CACTUS SLUGS on Carter's wound. eat the infection, excreting juice and pulling the skin t like a LIVING BANDAGE...as he winces badly...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Ow! It feels like the knives are still in there! wy

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: Don't touch. Let them work. Now eat. Regain your strength. She brings food to Carter and Dejah. Dejah studies her:

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Why are you helping us?

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: I believe as you do -- that the wrong Thark leads us. Thark children were once raised by their parents, not the King. Now they are taught to kill before they even know their names.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: And before Hajus, it was different? The question stops her. She stares off at the landscape:

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: My parents’ generation was the last to mate for love. Under Hajus, it was outlawed. Those Tharks who resisted, like my mother, fled to these mountains to raise us in secret. Until their hideaways were found.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: What happened to her?

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: She was executed. Like all the rest.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: And your father?

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: He stayed in the city. He surely believes I am dead... , (MORE).  71. SOLA (cont'd) But a few of us survived out here... and returned to Thark when we were grown. We blended in. Found our place.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: You‘ve never told your father that you're still alive? Sola shakes her head solemnly.

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: He would not want to know what I had lived to witness. That he is the greatest soldier for the Thark who destroyed our lives.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (realizes) Tars Tarkas...

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Your father is Tars Tarkas?! Sola regards them. Nods. Then, to Dejah:

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: You should never have come, you see. Because he’s forgotten -~ we've all forgotten ~- what‘’s worth fighting for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Tars stares grimly over the sands. He leads a searc patrol of twenty THARKS on thoats...as two Zodangan ASSAU FLIERS roar across the sky overhead--

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR JAKKAL
dialogues.text: Zodangan search planes! They’ve crossed into our territory!

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: It's only ours until they want it. Keep searching. No rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter, Dejah and Sola trek the jagged mountains, navigat treacherous trails. Carter gains strength as they go. Approaching a steep climb, their thoats falter. They won' it up the incline. The group trades a look -- and Carter removes the animals’ harnesses and reins--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Welcome home. You're free...  72. --and slaps their flanks, sending them into the wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The threesome climb. The route is precarious, but Carter to climb with confidence now, with Dejah behind him-- --till her footing gives way and she slips, sliding down scree right past Sola-- --just as Carter FREE-RAPPELS from above her, landing bel Dejah and catching her just in time before she slides ove perilous drop. And off their shared, grateful look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sola scans the route ahead with a digital spyglass, seein contrails in the sky. She motions they should wait... ..-and as Dejah looks for Carter, she finds him sitting o rock ledge, staring at Earth. A moment alone.:.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Why did he come for you? Sab Than. He was willing to fight all of Thark by himself. For you.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Not for me. Dejah considers...and finally unburdens the truth...

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: For the key to the Atmosphere Plant. It’s the secret my family is sworn to protect.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: And what if he’s right? What if inside the Plant there is a way to change the planet's fate?

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: If you could give one man control of Earth -- the weather, the tides, the oxygen -- would you? Would you trust that to anyone? Is that what its maker intended? Carter nods, muses. Dejah holds the stare.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: We could use a soldier like you.  73.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: This isn’t my war.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: For the fate of the world?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Your world. Not mine. Too harsh. Dejah looks away, stung.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: So am I, John. For the truth I didn’t tell you... (beat) Your friend the Earth Man is dead. Carter reacts, standing suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What are you talking about...

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: The tags you wear around your neck...I've seen them before. Your radio, your clothes -- I’ve seen them all. They rest in a museum -- in my city. With the skeleton of a man.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: That’s impossible...

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: The name on the tags is James Powell. Carter stops still.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: He was found buried in the Paktar Sea Beds. Over a hundred years ago.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: He traveled here ten minutes before I did!

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Ten minutes on your planet. It is you who say you traveled through time. (beat) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEJAH (cont'd) In the museum, he's our most famous exhibit. He‘s known as the “Proof.” That there is life on other worlds.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you tell me...

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Would you have helped me if I had? I said I'd help you find him. And I will. She starts toward him...

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: You came for your friend but you're a century too late.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I trusted you.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: I want you to. She reaches a gentle hand; he recoils from her touch.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Red men, green men, you‘re all the same. You want a soldier for your army -- to run, to fight, to kill. No one asks what I want--

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: You‘re not alone--

dialogues.speaker: I AM ALONE
dialogues.text: A silence. Hurt, anger and despair.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: There's a place for you in Helium -- with my people. With me. He meets her eyes...and turns his back on her. It's all t much for him. She lets her gaze fall.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Then may you find your way home, John Carter... Where the wars are your own. She walks away. Leaving him staring at his distant home planet...forever out of reach...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trio marches on, with Carter now far ahead. Sola trad look with Dejah -- why does he walk alone today? Dejah sh her head, feigns a mystery... ++-and as Sola and Dejah ascend a ridgetop, they find Car stopped in his tracks. At the gruesome sight of--

dialogues.speaker: TWENTY THARK HEADS ON PIKES
dialogues.text: Of tall, charred wood. The BONES of Thark arms and legs h like wind chimes from cross-beams. Some RHINO VULTURES fl cackling. It's like a macabre fence of scarecrows. Beyond the pikes is a dark, foreboding trail leading into TOWERING PETRIFIED FOREST. Sola stops, shaken, chilled by the sight...

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: The Ohn Tokk Wood. Warhoon country. Carter exchanges a look with Dejah.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Compared to them, the Tharks are philosophers.

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: And compared to a Thark, princess, you are a light snack. Suddenly, a HORN'S ECHO filters up from the rocky valley ascended from. Carter springs back to the ridge’s edge, scanning with the digital spyglass-- --until he spots a COLUMN OF THARK RIDERS, many miles dis snaking across a far ridge.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Riders. Looks like a Thark search party. I’d say a day away--

dialogues.speaker: WHEN SUDDENLY--
dialogues.text: A terrifying SHRIEK as A FEARSOME SHAPE SPRINGS UP in fro Carter's face! He’s knocked backward as he sees the hissi gnashing jaws of a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --rise from the rocks before him. The brute is adorned wi crude ANIMAL-BONE ARMOR and heavily tattooed with tribal markings, and before Carter can react, the Warhoon flashe

dialogues.speaker: STINGER WHIP--
dialogues.text: --which wraps around Carter's neck, choking him! Carter a his pistol, but the Warhoon snaps another WHIP, snaring h The gun falls. A third WHIP snares a leg -- a fourth WHIP snares his other leg. Sola rushes to his aid--

dialogues.speaker: HER BACK
dialogues.text: knocking her down. Dejah spins to see FOUR ARCHER WARHOON march over the rise beyond the pike-fence, with fierce CR aimed! Sola struggles up-- --and four more BOLTS drop her to the dust. Dejah rushes her sword, snaring it and turning--

dialogues.speaker: TO SEE TWENTY WARHOONS APPEAR
dialogues.text: over the rise, surrounding them in every direction!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Dejah--! --as he reaches out a hand and she throws him her sword-- --just as the Warhoon swings him with the whips toward a CREVASSE. Carter manages to slice three of the whips free grabbing the fourth and JERKING IT with all his might-- --which sends the surprised Whip Warhoon SKYING over the PLUMMETING into the crevasse to his death. Carter scrambl back atop the ridge--

dialogues.speaker: ONLY TO FIND HIMSELF SURROUNDED
dialogues.text: He and Dejah stand back-to-back, with wounded Sola trappe nearby...as the Warhoons close in on them. In what they a believe are their last moments...

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, John Carter. For everything. ---and as a bittersweet look passes between them...sudden DEEP RUMBLE sounds from above...and all look skyward to s

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN'S BAT-SHAPED BOMBER
dialogues.text: Now darkening the sky above, as it zeroes in and swoops t ground. The Warhoons part to clear a landing area--  77. --as the ship DOCKS, amidst exhaust vapor hued crimson by landing lights. A HATCH opens and out march Zodangan SOLD flanking Sab Than in his magnificent armor.

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN
dialogues.text: Dejah Thoris. At last. He reaches them...and studies Carter...

dialogues.speaker: SAB THAN
dialogues.text: And you. (beat) I waited years for you. And then I forgot. Carter stands his ground, as the Zodangan Prince now remo hawk-like helmet...to reveal THE RED-SKINNED FACE OF CAPT JAMES POWELL. Carter’s in total shock... ...as Powell grabs him in a forceful embrace. He claps Ca shoulders, beaming:

dialogues.speaker: POWELL AKA SAB THAN
dialogues.text: Beats some pretty red rocks, doesn’t it? Carter staggers, looking to Dejah...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Powell...

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Your friend? The Earth Man? No, he'‘s--

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: A skeleton in your museum? That‘s the Zodangan who first found me -~ in the desert, over a century ago. I took his life and left mine. (touches his red face) - It’s the atmosphere, Carter. In time, it’ll change you. Extend your life to. Powell nods to a black tribal marking on his throat, whic obscures a raised SCAR.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: That fall in the crevasse cut me open. Voice has never been the same. (a wry smile) Then again...what has?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You started this war...?  78.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Like we always said, Carter. Finally found something worth fighting for.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: For murder! You've killed millions!

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: This planet dies. You know it and know it. Someone had to tell them. Someone had to try and save it.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: You?! You will bring its death! She suddenly charges him -- only to be grabbed by Carter. instinct. He holds her firmly -- and Powell nods a thanks Dejah looks to Carter with betrayal...

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Where is the key to the Plant, Princess? Suddenly, Sola breaks free from the Warhoons and CHARGES. Powell instantly spins with his radium pistol--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: James, wait--! --as Carter steps in front of Powell's gun. Powell can’t fire. Then Carter spins on Sola--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Don't, Sola! Stop! Please... --and Sola stops short of her attempted attack...as Zodan forces now hold her fast. Powell narrows his eyes at Cart actions...and turns back to Dejah: POWELL . Everything you love will die...unless you tell me where I find the key.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Everything I love will die...when I do. Carter stands conflicted...as Powell turns to his soldier

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: To my ship. They haul Dejah away to the ship. Another group hauls up too. Powell regards them, rueful:  79.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Half this planet's run by savages. And the other half, philosophers. This world was desperate for men. Like you and me. INT. BOMBER - POWELL’S CABIN - DAY Powell leads Carter into a well-appointed room --~ with m charts on tables. Plates of food and drink.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Now as for “James,” you'll need to stop with the “James.” It's “Lord Prince,” that’s how they like it. You'll have your own title too. It’s incredible, isn’t it? What gravity allows us to do?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: On Earth...it was only ten minutes...

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: I landed like you did, in the Paktar Sea Beds. They were home to Zodangan villages then -- the poorest people on Mars. They took me in as one of their own. With my skills, I made a natural leader...and when I told them of their planet's fate, the word spread. And more villages started to follow.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Sab Than. The Desert Prophet.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Imagine it. An “Atmosphere Plant.” Imagine all life on Earth run by an ancient computer -~ causing famine, floods, global warming, all of it. What if all that could end? If we simply opened the computer and changed the program?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What if it can’t be changed?

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: You've spent too long with the Princess.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What if changing it destroys the computer?  80.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: We're men of action, Carter!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: It's not our place to play Gods.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: “Play” Gods?! WE ARE GODS! He roars it, with megalomaniacal amusement. Carter remain stone-faced. Powell’s smile fades:

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: What did we ever fight for on Earth? Religious strife, border disputes, oil supplies. I’m talking about whether or not a whole world survives! (a heartfelt plea) You're here now. We need you. Lee : CARTER We need to go home is what we need.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: I’ve been here for one hundred and thirty years, don’t you think I've searched? There are no portals on Mars. My army’s mapped every mile of it. This is the only home we have left! He indicates his opulent cabin quarters...

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: For fifteen years, we fought for others. You've never known what I've known. What it’s like...to be a leader. To be revered.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I know now.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: We were looking for treasure, John. You can’t fault me for finding it. His stare darkens. Carter shows no signs of taking his si

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: You‘re either with me or against me.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What happened to you...?  81.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: I‘ll leave you to the Warhoons unless you're with me.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I thought we were friends.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: We were. But that was a short time in my life. And a very long time ago. (beat) We’re both Gods here John. And if you‘re not with me, there’s only room for one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Warhoons crowd around a bound Carter, as he’s escorte the ship. He strains for one last glimpse of Dejah (thru window) as Powell’s ship closes-- -~and off ‘the fear in their eyes-- --Carter raises a hand in farewell-- -~as Powell steps to Dejah’s side, with a sad, bitter gaz

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Goodbye, my friend. As the ENGINES ROAR to life, Carter's surrounded by Warho with the Leader scrutinizing his features...with interest then a RIFLE BUTT comes crashing down and DARKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAR DRUMS and FIERCE CRIES are THUNDERING from somewhere. ...as Carter’s eyes flicker open. He struggles up to find himself in a filthy cage made from the RIBS of zitidars. black stalactites and stalagmites dot this cavern. He winces at his torn wound, which he tears away to revea ugly swollen bruise. It's nowhere near healed. Suddenly, there‘s a COMMOTION ahead. Four THARKS, in chai are hauled in by WARHOONS and thrown into a cell...

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Some of my best soldiers.  82. Carter spins. From the cage next to him, Tars Tarkas step the darkness. All four of his arms in chains.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: And all for you. Their cages separate them. Still, Carter steps back...

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: I swore I would kill you, Jonn-kata. It is a promise I will keep.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What is this? A prison?

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: The Warhoons take no prisoners. The WAR DRUMS build in volume. Faint screams from somewhe TARS TARKAS =: «. What did you want that the Tharks failed to offer you?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: My freedom. Have you never wanted that? Tars stares darkly.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I hear you were once an honorable people. Led by more than just shame and fear.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: A Thark fears nothing!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Your King fears everything. He separates children from their parents, so they have no one to fight for but him. He educates his people in battle alone. And he trusts no one who's not a Thark.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: As he never trusted you. (beat) Unlike me. Suddenly, the ROAR OF A THOUSAND WARHOON echoes through t caves. The WAR DRUMS pick up the pace. Tars tenses:  83.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: They're coming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four huge WARHOON GUARDS march Carter and Tars up a mine- incline. One of each man's legs are now connected by a te chain. WAR DRUMS pounding up ahead-- --as they emerge at one end of a football-field pit of LA ROCK. Uneven terrain, dotted with smoking FUMAROLES and burbling TAR PITS -- all bordered by towering SPIRES OF B like a giant ribcage rising from the rock. And it’s surrounded by HUNDREDS OF WARHOONS, drunk and wi event has the rowdy, illicit atmosphere of a cockfight -- grand scale. A BONFIRE along one wall lights the pit.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: It’s called the gauntlet. Their idea of sport. Carter and Tars are positioned inside a NEW CAGE, like a racehorse’s starting gate. They're flanked by two other “ -- one a pair of HELIUM MEN, one a pair of THARKS.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: If you make it to the other side...you live until the next one. Carter surveys the field: it's divided into three “sectio each marked with a natural ROCK PEDESTAL at the far edge. base has a large BONE-GRATE built into the ground before Atop the first pedestal are two SHIELDS, the second two A and the third -- a single BROADSWORD.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: And all we have to do is run?

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: You will want to. Suddenly, all the Warhoon drums suddenly STOP. And in the silence, the Warhoon Leader raises a cudgel and BELLOWS!

dialogues.speaker: AS SUDDENLY THE CAGE DOORS SNAF OPEN
dialogues.text: And the three “teams,” Tharks, Zodangans and Carter & Tar released into the arena! Ahead, the first BONE-GRATE unlo splitting inward--  84.

dialogues.speaker: AND ALLOWING A PACK OF CALOTS TO CHARGE OUT
dialogues.text: hurtling headlong for the teams! Nothing like Woola, thes wild, mangy and starved as~- --BAM! Carter gets DECKED by the Thark team and trampled chain goes taut and Tars hits the dirt. Angrily:

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Such a waste of my training. The snarling wild calots are halfway to them... ..-as the pair of Helium Men hit the calot line -- as the Man is SNATCHED up and driven backward. His teammate dive as the calot leaps over him, DEVOURING the first -- and s him free of the linked chain. Other calots COLLIDE with the Tharks, who are wrestled do manage to hurl the calots off and run onward-- --while the lone Helium Man scrambles up the first rock pedestal, about to grasp the SHIELD -- only to have his t chain SNARED by a Thark. The Tharks pull him back, hurlin aside-- ~-as Carter and Tars see the ten CALOTS all charging them

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: To the death, show no fear-- --as, unseen by him, Carter charges at Tars, and just as half-turns his way, Carter collides and GRABS HIM FAST--

dialogues.speaker: AND TANDEM-LEAPS INTO THE AIR
dialogues.text: SKYING RIGHT OVER the calots to land in a heap beyond! As ten calots reverse course, they scramble up--

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Ah. Some training after all. --while the Tharks pluck the SHIELDS from the pedestal, triggering the next BONE-GRATE ahead to collapse in--

dialogues.speaker: AND TWO TIGER-LIKE BANTHS CLAMBER OUT
dialogues.text: Giant, ten-legged carnivores, with thickets of razored te gleaming red eyes. They lumber toward the scent of prey.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Banths. Very bad...  85. As Carter and Tars watch the calots behind them DEVOUR th Helium Man, the Tharks CHARGE the banths, shields ready-- --until the Thark in the rear raises the razored-edge of shield and SLICES it across his partner's neck! His partn falls. The Thark SLICES again, severing his ally'’s foot- --and with both shields, the betrayer Thark CHARGES the b pile-driving them with the SHIELDS and blasting a path th their snapping jaws. He’s past them! And as one Banth lumbers to DEVOUR the helpless other Tha second CHARGES Carter & Tars! Carter nearly loses his balance...on the edge of one of the boiling TAR PITS--

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Stand your ground. When Carter tries to run, Tars holds him firm. Alarmed, h the Banth lunge at them, jaws wide-- --as Tars suddenly HURLS Carter to the right and dives to left, pulling their chain taut in mid-air-- --as the Banth CRASHES JAWS down upon...the chain! Splitt it! Carter and Tars are freed! The Banth whirls on Carter DIVES and ROLLS, evading snapping jaws. But the Banth’s T whips around, knocking Carter onto his back! The Banth lunges jaws again...and Carter GRABS two of its fangs! Blocking the Banth, struggling in place-- --and then with all his strength, PUSHING IT BACKWARDS. L blocking sled, he edges the Banth toward the tar pit righ behind it. The Banth shrieks, whipping its tail-- --but it can’t reach Carter, as Carter drives him into th boiling oil sludge tail-first. With one last leaping heav Carter upends the Banth -- BAM! -- onto its back-- --and leaps off as the screaming animal gets CONSUMED by smoking sludge. Carter looks to Tars...who nods approval. Up ahead, the lone Thark reaches the second pedestal and SPEARS -- which trigger the final BONE-GRATE to retract--

dialogues.speaker: AND A HULKING FOUR-ARMED SIMIAC
dialogues.text: climbs from his subterranean cage. It's one of the “Giant Carter fought at the Incubator, but this one is gray and their size. He has dragon-like scales, dirty, scarred and feral. He's the Warhoons’ prize fighter.  86.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: These guys. I hate these guys... The lone Thark is now armed to the teeth -- with two spea two shields. He's ready for the Simiac’s CHARGE-- --and as he hurls his spears, PIERCING the Simiac, it nev slows, grabbing all four of the Thark’s arms and SNAPPING off. He then grabs the shocked Thark by the torso-- --and shovels him into his mouth like a living hot dog. T Simiac wolfs down the Thark in seconds flat. He plucks ou spears like they're splinters... ...and then his gaze finds Carter and Tars.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Killed one once, didn‘t I?

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Yes. But that was a girl. At the sight of the Simiac, the remaining Banth and Calot away, cowering. The Warhoon crowd GOES WILD...

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE GAUNTLET PIT
dialogues.text: Carter spies the huge BONE SPIRES bordering the pit, an i forming. He spots the sword on the final rock pillar...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: We're in this together, aren’t we? Tars says nothing...as they lock eyes--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I need that sword. --and the Simiac CHARGES! Carter grabs the two SHIELDS fr fallen Thark-limbs. He LEAPS ASIDE as the Simiac swipes-- --and lands near the BONFIRE WALL bordering this section course. Carter dips the shields in a TAR PIT and then tou them to the bonfire-- --and the SHIELDS are aflame! He now stalks the Simiac -- as it throws FISTS, Carter blocks them with the FLAMING S causing the beast's paws to catch fire! But the Simiac seems unfazed, hurling now-FLAMING FISTS a Carter. Each impact knocks Carter yards backward, forcing to scramble up. His shields go flying--  87. --as with the diversion, Tars has a clear path to the ped He scrambles up, grabbing the SWORD.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Jonn-kata! He hurls it...and Carter leaps, landing beside a tar pit dipping the blade in tar just as the Simiac’s upon him-- --and Carter meets its flaming fist with the sword -- whi catches the SWORD AFLAME! With both hands, Carter slashes parries, fending off the beast‘s blows-- --and then leaps straight up, to eye-level, and SLASHES O Simiac’s eyes with a last FIERY SWING. Blinded, it HOWLS, stumbling back...right into the BONFIR Its whole body LIGHTS UP, consumed by fire-~ --as its arms flail -- BAM! BAM! -- colliding with one of tall bone spires...and cracking it...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Is that all you've got! IS THAT ALL

dialogues.speaker: YOU'VE GOT
dialogues.text: --and as the dying Simiac continues flailing and batterin

dialogues.speaker: THE CURVED BONE SPIRE CRACKS FREE
dialogues.text: Toppling backwards like a tree felled at the trunk...to B against the side of the gauntlet pit! Like a ramp out!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Go, go, go! Seizing the chance, Carter and Tars race up the bone spir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and find themselves on a table-land with a some mangy T and ZITIDARS tethered to a makeshift hitching post. Tars Carter to a sudden stop...and directs his gaze...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious Warhoons CHARGE OUT of the pit, scaling ladders, be brushed back by the FLAPPING WINGS of a MALAGOR--

dialogues.speaker: WITH TARS AND CARTER AT THE REINS
dialogues.text: As they evade the RIFLE BLASTS of the vanishing Warhoons-  88.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Thought you were gonna kill me.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: First things first. --as they soar ever-higher, to give us a new vantage of t Gauntlet Pit...where all those bone-spires form the RIBCA GARGANTUAN SKELETON. A prehistoric MARTIAN WHALE. BACK AT THE PIT’S EDGE While Warhoons roar with rage, they charge across the tab land -- and then several suddenly COLLIDE and fall back-~ --as if they've hit something invisible...which they have RIPPLING HEAT-MIRAGE turns into a ZODANGAN ASSAULT FLIER engines FIRE. Two PILOTS have been lying in wait--

dialogues.speaker: ZODANGAN PILOT
dialogues.text: Alert the Prince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Towering cliffs of rock, miles high, flank a long-dry riverbed...as the Malagor SOARS through a narrow pass...w there are ominous STORMCLOUDS on the horizon... -.-and now the Malagor suddenly SHRIEKS, tugging at its r Tars struggles to keep it flying level--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What's wrong?! Tars’ eyes narrow, at the darkening skies:

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: There's something...out there... And as they stare at the OMINOUS CANOPY ahead, they watch image ripple slightly, as if there’s a MIRAGE in front... closer...the mirage of a small airship...

dialogues.speaker: AND SUDDENLY BLUE RADIUM BOLTS OPEN FIRE
dialogues.text: from nowhere! The Malagor dives low, evading as the ASSAU FLIER zips past, again MATERIALIZING INTO VIEW--~ --as do its two Pilots at the open-air ship's controls. T ship BANKS in pursuit of the Malagor.  89.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: It is a Zodangan Assault Flier! We will never outrun it! We have to get to the clouds!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Malagor SOARS into the ominous clouds, wisps of heavy Winds whip harder here, buffeting them all.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You're taking us into a storm!

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: They will never follow! This is no storm, Jonn-kata -- it is where all our weather starts!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (in amazement) The Atmosphere Plant?! Tars nods. They look back to see the Assault Flier sweep through rumbling clouds, DIVING toward them.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: And they'll never follow, huh? The Flier OPENS FIRE -- as RADIUM-BOLTS rip into the Mala WINGS, shredding and smoking them! The creature WAILS, as drives it through more clouds-- --as they watch the diving Flier DROP AWAY and disappear the gray cirrus below--

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Take the reins! Pull these to dive -- on my signal!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What about you?! Tars weighs him with a grudging smile:

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: On my signal... He edges out to the Malagor’s wing, and spots a GLIMPSE o Assault Flier through the clouds below--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and Carter pulls hard on the low reins, forcing the Mal chin down and DIVE-BOMBING-- --to FLASH RIGHT PAST the Assault Flier as Tars LEAPS OFF

dialogues.speaker: AND TACKLES THE PILOTS ABOARD THEIR FLIER
dialogues.text: to their shock, as Tars’ four arms sweep them all overboa they FALL THROUGH THE CLOUDS, guns firing-- --while Tars just barely manages to hang on to the side o Flier, which wobbles badly, going down--

dialogues.speaker: AS ABOARD THE MALAGOR
dialogues.text: Carter loses sight of Tars. He’s hit by a GUST of turbule the Malagor WAILS, its strength giving out. Carter tugs a reins, but the beast stops flapping--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: No! Hang on! C'mon, HANG ON! --as they cut through the clouds, lower and lower, until suddenly huge DUNES OF BLACK SAND rise up dead ahead...an Malagor CRASHES to Earth and the whole world goes DARK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE SOARS above the BLACK SMOKE and RUBBLE that once wa small Helium farming community. Destroyed by Zodanga’s fo A ribbon of REFUGEES trudges across the land...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +..as Dejah watches from the window of Powell’s quarters. sits in his captain-like chair:

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Tell me, “James Powell.” What sort of man sends his friend to his death?

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: You send an entire people. Their fate is sealed -~ and yet you ask them to fight.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: I ask them to follow their conscience. Powell rises and approaches her as she presses...

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: For millennia, our meager resources have been shared among us all. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEJAH (cont'd) We've rationed and conserved. And then you arrive...to say no such sacrifices must be made. (beat) Despite the fact you have no proof.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: I will. Once I have your key. He stands close. She holds her ground.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Wherever it’s hidden, you will tell me. The war ends the moment you do. He reaches for her hand, raises it...and presses his lips

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: I taste blood on them, princess. He exits, leaving her alone at the window. She stares out at the column of refugees...and places a hand to her stom lifting the edge of her clothes-- ~-to reveal that the gold royal crest that pierces her na empty. The inset DIAMOND STONE is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STORMCLOUDS surround...with FLASHES OF HEAT LIGHTNING on horizon, as amidst dunes of VOLCANIC ASH...rests a dead M half-buried. From beneath one of its wines... struggles a battered, as covered Carter. But he’s alive. He surveys the clouds...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Tars Tarkas?! TARS TARKAS!!! But only wind HOWLS back. So he crawls up the dune...wher confronted with a black desert vista...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a high vantage, Carter trudges ahead through FIERCE and SWIRLING BLACK ASH -- i:so:0ssibly harsh conditions. THUNDER is ominous and constant... He keeps struggling onward, 2s FORKS OF LIGHTNING connect an ash dune peak in the dis*ance... In the midst of the tempest, he falls to his knees, braci body, pounded by SWIRLING :°‘i...as he starts to crawl fo hand-over-struggling-hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter's eyes snap open, battered by the gale. He's colla from exhaustion. And yet a mere few yards ahead...

dialogues.speaker: THERE'S A SINGLE BLUE FLOWER
dialogues.text: poking out of the ash. Weakly, Carter pulls himself towar and as he reaches for the flower~- --his hand passes through a curtain of ash...to touch the on the other side. Where the air is still. Carter drags himself forward, through the weather “curtai

dialogues.speaker: TO FIND HIMSELF IN A FIELD OF BLUE FLOWERS
dialogues.text: In a grassy expanse, utterly calm, and towering above him

dialogues.speaker: IS THE ATMOSPHERE PLANT
dialogues.text: A GIANT COLUMN of twisting white clouds rises three miles the air from it, feeding the very atmosphere of Mars. It' the eye of a hurricane. Storm winds swirl all around it, here -- on the inside -- all is calm. The sheer metal edi ‘has no doors, no windows. No way inside. Awestruck, Carter staggers to the wall of the building -- covers four square miles and towers two hundred feet. He to the ground, exhausted...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: The whole war...over this... He laughs ruefully, delirious from his trek. His laughter convulses his body -- he winces, holding his wound. And t keels over. The wound is really hurting him now-- --and as he looks down, he sees a STRANGE GLOW coming fro side, like a hot coal inside his skin, as his scar starts split apart. His flesh grows WHITE HOT--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEARS out from his side, “projecting” on the wall of the like a CURTAIN OF ENERGY, which causes a DOOR-SIZED SECTI the wall to RIPPLE INTO VIEW-- --and then the section of wall VANISHES as if it were nev there, revealing a long silver corridor! And the BEAM OF LIGHT cuts off, leaving a WHITE HOT INGOT Carter’s side as it slips free out of the wound--  93. -- al itse to be Dejah‘s DIAMOND ‘ONE. It hits the ground and cools, all its energy receding. Carter stares in complete amazement...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: The key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long hall, with another RIPPLING “DOOR” at the end. It’ an airlock -- between a space where the laws of physics a and another where they don't. And as Carter walks through, clutching the “key” in his hand...his WOUNDS mysteriously heal, his skin is CLEANED ash...and his limping gait becomes strong and sturdy...as passes through the beckoning “ripple”~-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --into the plant itself. He finds himself on a balcony, overlooking a METROPOLIS-SIZED EXPANSE OF MACHINERY. It e for miles ahead, miles above and miles below. And as he turns to where he expects the “door” to be, he it extends for miles behind hin.

dialogues.speaker: A VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Welcome, John Carter. Carter spins back to see a TINY OLD MAN in a cloak, inche from his face, seemingly hovering above the machinery cha He's impossibly aged, nearly mummified, but with a slight enlarged head and features...and white skin.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Who...are you...

dialogues.speaker: THE OROVAR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The one who remained. (beat) On all our worlds, there is always one who remains. Carter reacts, incredulous. The man’s mouth has not moved speaks telepathically.

dialogues.speaker: THE OROVAR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I am the last of the Orovars. The little man hovers before him. Expressionless.  94.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You...you run the Plant?

dialogues.speaker: THE OROVAR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It runs itself. I merely stay.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: THE OROVAR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: In the event we ever must come back, I must let the others know. That Mars is safe. That life goes on. (beat) It is the same with your planet Earth.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You know where I'm from... The Orovar nods sagely.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What else do you know?

dialogues.speaker: THE OROVAR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That you wish to return. With that, the Orovar waves a slow hand... With a familiar HUM, a TRANSLUCENT PEDESTAL rises from th depths of the plant -- until it’s level with their platfo Then a CANOPY OF RED FIRE-GEM CRYSTALS shimmers into view around it -- just like the portal chamber in the cave.

dialogues.speaker: THE OROVAR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Our pathways were never meant to be discovered. Our worlds should never have crossed. With another wave, a HOLOGRAM WALKWAY, like a shimmering appears -- from the platform to the pedestal.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Is that...my way home...?

dialogues.speaker: THE OROVAR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Your way is of your own volition. He motions Carter onto the holo-walk. Carter takes a step it‘'s translucent and shimmering, but it's solid.  95.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I don't understand. If you Orovars can create worlds, create life...why don't you interfere? With the fates you've set in motion?

dialogues.speaker: THE OROVAR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It is our science.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: And your planets are...experiments?

dialogues.speaker: THE OROVAR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That we may one day know the essential nature...of whatever intelligence created us. Carter advances, nearing the portal. But then...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What will happen if Powell takes over the Atmosphere Plant?

dialogues.speaker: THE OROVAR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: To attempt to control it will be to destroy it.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Then you'll stop him.

dialogues.speaker: THE OROVAR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: One does not stop an experiment.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You'll just stand by? You’ll just watch this planet die? The Orovar stares patiently. As if dealing with a child.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I helped start this war. You know that? It’s my fault he’s here.

dialogues.speaker: THE OROVAR, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: In science, there are causes. There is no such thing as fault.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Someone has to tell him! That all this can't be controlled! Someone has to stop him! Carter stares at the diamond stone in his hand...  96.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What if the key remains inside the Plant?

dialogues.speaker: THE OROVAR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It is one. It is not the only.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Goddammit! Don’t you know what's happening?! There’s a war out there and millions are dying! Why won't you involve yourself?!

dialogues.speaker: THE OROVAR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Why won't you. He speaks without judgement. Carter despairs, looks to th portal. The beckoning crystals...the way home...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: And would I survive? Would she? The Orovar says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’m one man. What can I do?

dialogues.speaker: THE OROVAR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yes, John Carter. Forever and always. That is the experiment. With a heavy sigh, Carter sets his jaw...and steps to the pedestal. The crystal canopy begins to GLOW, and a HUM ri The Orovar lifts a farewell hand... The HUM grows deafening. The crystals BLAZE RED. And Cart conflicted face is bathed in a BLINDING GLOW...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The field of blue flowers is serene and still...as a pair BOOTS step out from the plant. _ Carter emerges... .+-and turns to see the Orovar in the RIPPLING “doorway.”

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Never leave a man behind. The little man hovers with a faint smile on his face. Sci interest? Envy? Pride?

dialogues.speaker: THE OROVAR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Look to the southwest skies.  97. And then the “doorway” turns opaque...and is a wall again Carter turns to the “curtain” of weather...starting to re his choice...and now stares skyward, hearing faintly...

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Jonn-kata, are you out there?! CAN YOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amidst the stormclouds, the Zodangan Assault Flier HOVERS Tars Tarkas at the helm. He struggles to control the ship his SEARCHLIGHT sweeps the dunes-- --and now illuminates Carter rushing into view, waving ar signal. With amazement, Tars broadly smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the STORM CLOUDS, the Assault Flier SHOOTS away, fla flares of LIGHTNING...with Tars and Carter aboard. Tars turns to see Carter staring at the receding storm.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: What happened to you back there?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (a distant stare) I saw my future. Tars turns back to the flier’s controls, smoke pours from underside as the engines STRAIN.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Why did you come back?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I saw a friend in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: A...friend... Tars frowns as if it’s a word he’s only heard about.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: I have ten thoats, Jonn-kata; you may take your choice from among them, and I will accompany you to the nearest waterway that leads to Helium. (off Carters look) Tars Tarkas may be a cruel warrior, but he can be a friend as well.  98.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: And what happens when you return to Thark without me?

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Death, possibly, or worse. (beat) Is this not a choice “friends” make?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Why do you fight for him? The great Thark stops. Something registers.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: A soldier follows orders.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: From the Thark who killed his family? Tars' eyes narrow suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I know about her, General. How she kept your name a secret. How she died to save you and your child.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: No...you know nothing...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I know you once fought for her. You once fought for love.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I heard the story from your daughter herself. From Sola. Turning toward him, Tars suddenly stops as if shot.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: She’s a prisoner of Zodanga -- along with the princess. She believes in a better way for her people.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Sola? Tars wears a distant, dark stare.  99.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: On my planet, armies march for flags and leaders. But we fight for our family and our children. I know of no greater honor than that. Tars looks as if he’ll kill Carter then and there. But in he turns away...

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: I have orders, Jonn-kata. To return to Thark.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Then we go together. Tars stops. Looks back.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: And you can watch one more life end for you. Tars turns away and stares over the bow...at another Heli FARMING SETTLEMENT below -- all skeletons and scorched ea now. And off the dark look in Tars’ eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Assault Flier SOARS across the desert. Atop a city wa CANNON GUNNERS draw a bead...until they hear a distinctiv HORN. And now see Tars Tarkas at the helm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The War Council is in session, with Tal Hajus slumped in central pulpit. An elder Councilor is speaking--

dialogues.speaker: THARK ELDER
dialogues.text: But my King, the desert wells will not sustain us. And Zodanga refuses us fair rates of trade--

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: Tharks will survive! We have always survived! Let the red men slaughter each other and we will remain-- Suddenly, the doors THUNDER open as a Thark GUARD races i

dialogues.speaker: THARK GUARD
dialogues.text: A Zodangan ship--!  100.

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: A war council is in session--!

dialogues.speaker: THARK GUARD
dialogues.text: It is General Tarkas! A MURMUR in the room. Hajus’ face falls...as suddenly a T rides right in to the council chamber, with Tars Tarkas a Carter his prisoner. Tars dismounts, hauls Carter down-~- --spilling him to the floor, hands bound, before the coun

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: He is found. Hajus scowls to see Tars alive...but hides his displeasur

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: Then let us have his execution.

dialogues.speaker: / CARTER . ,
dialogues.text: I’ demand the right to speak:

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: (to Tars) Cut him apart. First his tongue. Tars hesitates. Tal Hajus eyes’ narrow with suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: General Tarkas--

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: He is still a Thark. Last words are his right. Hajus glowers, feeling the stare of the War Councilors.

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: Speak. Then you die. Carter slowly stands, and faces.the Thark audience:

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Soldiers of Thark...I’ve been one among you. I've fought shoulder to shoulder. You're a brave people and you love bravery, but is that all? Tal Hajus dreams of war -- of carnage and suffering. While you true warriors dream...of an end to it all. (turns to Hajus) You’ve made your people into an arsenal, not an army. (MORE).  101. CARTER (cont'd) You‘re merely weapons that kill -- without asking what you’re killing for.

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: For Thark!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Which Thark? Who? Tell me just one name. One Thark whose life matters more than your own. All await his answer. And he has none...
