dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: What “one Thark”? All of Thark! Only a child would mourn the death of just one Thark! (to Tars, rages) Enough, Tarkas! Kill him! Now! But Tars doesn’t move. His eyes are on Carter's.

dialogues.speaker: I SAID KILL HIM
dialogues.text: So Hajus himself draws four BATTLE AXES and LEAPS DOWN fr pulpit, only to have Tars step in front of Carter:

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: I demand Justice. An astonished gasp from the room...

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: I challenge you. Hajus stares, stunned...as Tars pulls his own four swords whole War Council is watching...

dialogues.speaker: TAL HAJUS
dialogues.text: Here is your death. - And Hajus charges. Their weapons CRASH together, with thundering two-armed s It’s a meeting of veteran warricrs -- despite Hajus’ corp he's a worthy opponent. They strike and spin, powering st against steel-- --as their multi-limbs bash the BLADES back and forth. Ha charges like a wild bull, keeping Tars off-balance. He fi like a Thark possessed, unbowed by any HITS that Tars lan He’s starting to wear Tars down-~-  102. --and KNOCKS three of his swords from his hands with a RO sweep of his axes. Tars now holds a lone sword-- --and now glances to Carter, remembering their “fencing” Tars takes a balanced stance-- --and as Hajus gleefully CHARGES for the kill, Tars moves on a single axis, PARRYING all four strikes with only one own. Hajus’ last lunge leaves him off-balance-- --and Tars now ATTACKS, lunging forward, moving Hajus bac his heels, seizing an opening, SWEEPING his sword-- --and he CUTS OFF the King's head. The rest of Tal Hajus to the floor. A shocked silence in the room. Then Tars turns to face the assembled THARK OFFICERS...an does, they all kneel. For him now. Tars regards the elders of the War Council. They Bow thei heads in deference too.

dialogues.speaker: THARK COUNCILLOR
dialogues.text: It is Justice...my King. Finding Carter’s eyes, Tars gets a nod of gratitude and r And Carter kneels too.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: We await your command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tars Tarkas clambers atop the ruined gates, where HUNDRED THARKS have assembled, with more coming, as news of their King spreads. There’s excitement in the air... -.-and from around a corner, a calot comes running at ful speed, just as Carter turns in amazement--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Woola...?! --as Woola, alive and well, tackles him to the ground, sl him with a grotesque tongue! He‘s streaked with SCARS fro radium bolt. But loyal and overjoyed...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay, okay -- I’m happy to see you too, yeah, all right... And as he struggles up, Tars address the growing crowd:  103.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Soldiers of Thark! Our planet has long been dying, yet forever have the Tharks survived! And forever more we will. But only if Zodanga falls. For they fight for a fantasy...that will destroy us all. (beat) The peaceful people of Helium shall never defeat Zodanga alone, nor will we, but together...there is hope. He trails off, surveying the stone Thark faces. No signs like minds. But still, he tries:

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Tharks have never made alliances, and this is not our war. I will not command you to go. However, any Thark who volunteers... He looks to Carter below, in the gateway:

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: -.-we'll take him. A moment‘s silence, and then one of Tars’ senior officers Jakkal, steps up beside Carter.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR JAKKAL
dialogues.text: We will take him. And then a boyish young Thark Captain joins the group...

dialogues.speaker: THARK CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: We will take him. .--and now the words start to spread into the crowd, like rallying cry, as swords are lifted...

dialogues.speaker: THARK SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: We will take him./We will take him! We will take him!/WE WILL TAKE HIM! And as the cries build to a deafening THUNDER, with sword pikes thrust into the air, Tars meets Carter's eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The great doors are thrown open, casting light on the mig pack-animal ZITIDARS as THARKS rush in to prepare them.  104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THARKS swarm the weapons cases, piling armfuls of blades, and armaments. Girding for war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK-AND-GREEN FLAGS whip in the wind -- standards held THARK RIDERS on thoats. Tars paces before them, with Cart War Councilors nearby:

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Our city alone willbe no match. There are six other tribes of Tharks amidst the desert. You must enlist as many as you can.

dialogues.speaker: THARK COUNCILLOR
dialogues.text: They have never fought under a common flag, my King.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: It is not a flag they will fight for. He spins back to the contigent of riders, bellowing:

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Tell them Tars Tarkas will be the first into battle! With or without them! For he would rather fight and die, then to wish that fate upon his children! Tell them the great city of Thark fights for no flag, but for our mothers and fathers, our daughters and sons!

dialogues.speaker: MAY WE ONCE MORE PRAISE THEIR NAMES
dialogues.text: He raises high his sword...and the riders SPUR their moun galloping off with vigor and purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SIX RIDERS gallop out of the city gates, immediately out to ride in different directions...charging and vanish into six furious clouds of sand:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter, Tars, Jakkal and other officers stride into the p see A THOUSAND THARKS standing in formation.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: March them for Helium by the Kabar Pass. Save your best fifty for me. We take the Old Canal Road.  105.

dialogues.speaker: JAKKAL
dialogues.text: But that leads to Zodanga... Tars nods to Carter, then addresses his officers:

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Jonn-kata has a friend to find. (beat) And I have a daughter to save.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zodangan CARRIER SHIPS and FIGHTERS take off for the fron leaving the murky city...as ANGLE closes on its castle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officers and soldiers are busy with maps and screens -- o IMAGES of the Assault on Helium. Its patchwork force shie severely damaged. The bombardment is relentless... ...and on the room's bridge level, Dejah sits prisoner, w the destruction with tears in her eyes. To the side sits heavily chained and flanked by GUARDS.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: How much more death are you willing to witness, princess?

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: One. She stares daggers. Powell smiles thinly. He motions to a TECHNICIAN, who brings up on-screen images of three float Helium AIRSHIPS, apparently taken captive.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: We captured these refugee ships en route to your polar outposts. Tell me what I want and I will spare them. (beat) Where is the key? Dejah watches the screen, says nothing. This destroys her

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: (to an Officer) Detonate. On screen, one of the refugee ships EXPLODES. Two remain.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Where is the key?  106. Dejah shuts her eyes. A tear rolls down her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: (to the Officer) Detonate. On screen, the second refugee ship EXPLODES. One now left

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: On Earth, there was once a great war -- a war for the whole world. Do you know what it took to end it? The death of innocents. Of whole cities. And if that's what Mars requires ... (firmly) I only take your lives to save them. More tears roll down Dejah’s face. Powell turns to his Of to give the last command, when--

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: Princess! :

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: (hisses) Silence! Powell stops. He studies the look that passes between the the revelation dawns...

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: You know... (incredulous) The Thark knows. Sola looks wary. Dejah glares a look of resolve.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Tell me the key’s location, Thark... and the princess lives. Powell draws his sword and puts it to Dejah’s throat.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Silence, Sola! I command you!

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sola's torn. Dejah’s stare is resolute. And as Powell pre the swordpoint, drawing blood...

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: Jonn-kata. Jonn-kata has the key.  107. And off Powell's astonished look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Zodangan FLIER passes, on patrol... as Woola pops into from a ROCK OUTCROP. He surveys the distant thicket of “s reaching high into the noxious clouds-- --and woola-woola-woolas that the coast is clear to Carte and the fifty-Thark STRIKE FORCE laying in wait. Tharks u TENTED CAGES atop two ZITIDARS-~- --to reveal MALAGORS inside. A way to reach the skies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Among the stilts, four Malagors SOAR into the clouds -- e ferrying ten Tharks, faces shielded by scarves--

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Do not breathe until we are past the red men’s poisons... --and Carter presses a scarf over his face too as they en PLUMES of GRAY and BROWN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Powell now approaches Sola with the sword...

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: Jonn-kata was hurt in our escape. When the princess tended to his wound, she placed the stone from her royal crest inside it. (looks away) She does not know I saw her... Powell’s stunned. He marches to Dejah and rips her silks to reveal the gold mounting at her navel. Empty of its di stone.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: You had your key.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: You entrusted this planet to him? He's ready to strike her -- then spins to his officers:

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Send ships back to Warhoon lands! Talk to every single savage and find the Earth Man's grave!  108.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: What makes you so sure he has one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amidst the THUNDEROUS deployment of further troops -- uns whisper-quiet -- the Malagors ASCEND to castle level-- --encountering a trio of LOK-WING GLIDERS on patrol, but the shocked Pilots can sound an alarm, Thark ARCHERS shoo from the skies! The Malagors land on the parapets of Castle Zodanga, as t Thark strike force leaps off and slips into the shadows. Tars, Carter and Woola among them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell stalks toward Dejah...

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: There was a time I envisioned a future for us, Princess. A peaceful union of our cities. You and I, side by side. (beat) But I learned one thing on Earth. Peace is the time between wars. It’s never the end in itself. He draws his sword as he’s almost there...

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: We're at war, Princess. You are my enemy. This is your end. And as he raises his sword high to strike her down--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Princess of Helium! Powell spins to the far doors to the war room...where Car stands alone, radium pistol aimed right at him...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Your mission is accomplished. The entire room of officers and technicians is momentaril frozen. One man? Alone? And then they watch as Tars Tarka step to his side. And then two more Tharks. And then ten. as Powell realizes--

dialogues.speaker: THE FIFTY THARKS COME STORMING IN
dialogues.text: From all entrances, causing INSTANT CHAOS! They slash SWO and throw SPEARS ~- four at a time -- taking down the Zod who scramble for guns. Carter FIRES and Powell dives aside. Dejah tries to run b Powell LEAPS across the bridge level and grabs her-- --as Carter LEAPS in kind, up to the bridge level, while Zodangans and Tharks BATTLE it out on the level below. Po has Dejah held before him as a shield--

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Her life for the key, Carter! Sola’s two guards have pistols drawn, aimed at Carter. Ca pistol is on Powell. And Powell‘s sword is at Dejah’s thr It’s a standoff.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Her life for the key... Carter wavers, and then retrieves a small POUCH--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Release her first.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: The key first. They stare each other down, as Carter relents and tosses pouch...as Powell hurls Dejah aside -- but backwards -- i arms of his guards! Powell snares the pouch--

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Noll: --as it opens...and out falls a U.S. Army CONCUSSION GREN Powell's face falls as he immediately spins and LEAPS-- --as the grenade DETONATES, propelling his “leap” with do force, smashing him into the screens of the War Room. Dej Sola and the guards are all thrown backwards-- --with Sola blown off the bridge level, down to the techn area where the Zodangan/Thark MELEE is in full force-- --while Dejah is blown into a dcorway. She scrambles up a runs, with the stunned guards in pursuit--  110. --as Carter springs up FIRING at Powell, who GAMBOLS to a catwalk, as nimble and agile as Carter -- and he’s gone. looks back to the Tharks--

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Save the princess, Jonn-~kata! --and so he races for the exit corridor-- --while Tars SLASHES on, with Tharks swiftly taking contr the room. RADIUM SHOTS fire and a few Tharks fall, but mo DOWN the Zodangans like wheat. Woola runs wild... ..-and as Tars MOWS through Zodangans, he reaches the bac the room, where fallen Sola lies unconscious, still chain Tars stops still at the sight of her. He’s overcome with emotion -- and collapses to her side--

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Sola...Sola, hear me... He brushes her face, as her eyes flutter open. She starts brighten, then troubled, looks away--

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: I‘ve betrayed you, General...

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: And I you, my child. And off her astonishment...

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Princess of Thark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dejah outruns the Guards to the docking station for Powel Bomber Ship. An access door LOCKS behind her, leaving the guards on the other side...and as she thinks she’s safe-- --Powell suddenly DROPS into view from high above.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Time to pay, Princess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter races in pursuit, seeing the Guards struggling wit access door. And just as it starts to rise--  lil. --Carter OPENS FIRE, with RADIUM BOLTS felling the Guards races toward them, hearing the RUMBLE of engines-—-~ INT. POWELL’S BOMBER --as Powell’s at the controls, hurling Dejah to the floor ship RUMBLES to life. When he turns his back, Dejah races the open entry hatch, but she's too late-- --just as the Bomber Ship LIFTS OFF--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and Carter emerges on scene to see the ship LEAVING the Drifting away with an arcing turn...twenty feet...forty...seventy... --and as Carter meets Dejah‘s eyes, at the open hatchway- --he never breaks stride, racing the length of the dock-- AND LEAPING INTO THE AIR’ “~? With a hard step off the dock’s edge...skying an arc towa ever-departing ship-- --a full mile above the unseen ground below-- --and as his seventy-foot arc nears its end, perilously c falling short, Dejah extends both arms out the hatchway--

dialogues.speaker: AND HE CATCHES THEM
dialogues.text: At the very last second! Their arms lock like trapeze art as his weight pulls her body down the hatchway...but her catch hold on support rails! They hang from the ship as i SPEEDS UP and ASCENDS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Dejah race back to the cockpit-- --only to see Powell's pilot chair BREAK LOOSE in a HISS STEAM as it REVERSE-EJECTS, with a hatch opening-~

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --as Powell drops out from the ship, as his chair SPROUTS like wings and he tips forward, ENGINES firing--  112. --as it becomes a LOK-WING GLIDER and transports him towa AIRSHIP CARRIER on the far side of the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Dejah watch him escape...as Carter reveals her DIAMOND STONE and hands it over. Dejah beams. She secures back in her navel’s gold mounting...

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: I knew you'd come... And as they drift toward a turning SKY CANNON, Dejah leap the remaining pilot’s seat--

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Time to fly. --as she FIRES their wing-guns and obliterates it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bomber LANDS back at the dock, where Tars, Sola, Wool forty surviving Tharks are waiting...

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: (from the controls) Everyone aboard the ship! Tharks lay down COVER FIRE, trading BLASTS with Guards on castle turrets. As Tars boards--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I give you Tars Tarkas, Princess... King of Thark.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: We are eternally in your debt.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: And we shall eternally remember it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Powell's LOK-WING lands, WINGS retracting as he sna of his belt and the chair-glider hits the ground-- --as he marches past DOZENS OF AIRMEN scurrying into thei Assault Fliers. A stunned COLONEL races to him--

dialogues.speaker: ZODANGAN. COLONEL
dialogues.text: Lord Prince, those were Tharks--  113.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Helium. As fast as this thing can fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As CARRIER PLATFORMS detach from their spire perches and FLIERS launch, the heroes’ stolen Bomber BLASTS AWAY from city...just ahead of the attacking wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The war rages on as ANGLE FOLLOWS a FLEET of a thousand Z ASSAULT FLIERS on a kamikaze path for Helium...as the shi become HEAT-MIRAGES, rendered near-invisible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tardos Mors issues orders with his ADVISERS, as the entir palace SHUDDERS around them, starting to crumble from the barrage, as SCREAMING ENGINES rise-- --and he sees the “MIRAGE”-LIKE DISTURBANCES IN THE SKY--

dialogues.speaker: FORTIFY SHIELDS
dialogues.text: ..-which now OPEN FIRE! EXPLOSIONS ring out as the invisi enemy STRAFES the city! Their concentrated FIRE blows rip holes in the city’s DOME-LIKE FORCE SHIELD -- allowing th attack the inner city! The King and his Advisers race for cover as EMBER BOMBS l the palace gardens and hot EMBER-FRAG blows through the w and obliterates our view in SPARKING WHITE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell's stolen airship SOARS toward Helium, with the ent Zodangan Fleet now in staggered pursuit... INT. POWELL’S BOMBER Tars sits at the helm, with Carter, Dejah and Sola ~~ as flier is BUFFETED by gunfire--

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: I must tell you. These Zodangans... they build lovely machines to fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --as Tars DIVEBOMBS the ship toward the ground, trying to Assault Fliers on their tail...while other Tharks man the cannons, RETURNING FIRE.  114.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZODANGAN BATTALIONS march through the mouth of the valley separating their troop encampments from the borders of He THOUSANDS of TROOPS storm toward the city-- --where the AIR BATTLE has already commenced, with EXPLOS raining through the floating sections of the metropolis-~ --as HELIUM DEFENSE ENGINEERS race backup “SHIELD GENERAT into position. Like fixed searchlights that make up the “patchwork” sections of the FORCE SHIELD enclosing the ci Wherever a section is breached, the engineers aim a backu --as Helium SCOUT FLIERS and INTERCEPTORS take to the ski dogfight with their near-invisible foes--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a city overlook, Tardos Mors rushes through the rubb gaze down at the oncoming ground BATTALIONS. Directly ben the suspended city, Helium’s own GROUND TROOPS await. But they're severely overmatched.

dialogues.speaker: TARDOS MORS
dialogues.text: Too many, too strong...if the shields fall, we're finished...

dialogues.speaker: HELIUM OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: They‘re on the palisades! The King gazes upward...to the ridges that rim the idylli valley, to see MORE SOLDIERS sweep into view... -..except these soldiers are Tharks. A THOUSAND THARKS come scrambling pell-mell over the vall palisades, with ZITIDARS perched high, as Tharks toss dow weapons from the tented cargo holds on their backs.

dialogues.speaker: TARDOS MORS
dialogues.text: Send word to all commanders! Let the Tharks join the ranks! Let them join! (with amazement) They fight for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Led by Major Jakkal, the Tharks join the fray...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ++-racing past the line of Helium defenses for the honor being the first into battle! They meet the Zodangan Battalions on the battlefield HEAD sweeping four-armed spear and blade-strikes into the line RADIUM RIFLE-firing soldiers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaching Helium, Powell stands with two ADMIRALS, surv the AERIAL DOGFIGHT that’s begun--

dialogues.speaker: ZODANGAN ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: The Tharks are with them, Lord Prince.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: They are to few and no match for our technology. Fire at will. Destroy those shields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helium Interceptors DODGE and WEAVE, as the “mirage”-shro Assault Fliers SHOOT THEM DOWN like child’s play. They th make STRAFING RUNS, blowing HOLES in the city's blisterin struggling FORCE SHIELD... .+-while Helium BATTLESHIPS move out to confront the onco Zodangan CARRIERS. Deck cannons EXCHANGE FIRE. INT. POWELL’S BOMBER Swooping and diving, outgunning its Assault Flier pursuer the Helium AIR BATTLE appears on the horizon--

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: We’re no match for their fighters! We can’t even see them!

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: You red men. You send machines to fight machines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where SHADOWS come soaring into view over the valley...

dialogues.speaker: AS A DOZEN MALAGORS AND RIDERS TAKE TO THE AIR
dialogues.text: The wild pterodactyls SWOOP into the sky, and two immedia pick up the JET FUEL scent, locking onto pursuit of two "mirages.” They dive and swirl, relentless-—-  116. ~--until they get close enough for their RIDERS to fire m PULSE GUNS! They score direct hits -- as two Vanguards no MATERIALIZE. Damaged and visible-- --as they sail into the path of Helium anti-aircraft cann which now are able to lock on -- and BLOW THEM TO BITS. INT./EXT. POWELL'’S BOMBER

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: You may now ride the skies without fear. . --when suddenly BOOM! Reverberations SHAKE the ship as th a Helium Battleship LISTING up ahead, overwhelmed by the Zodangan Carrier's relentless FIRE. EXPLOSIONS wrack the Battleship and it falls away like a capsizing ocean liner, with Helium soldiers PLUMMETING fr decks as it falls... ...and SMASHES ‘to ground’ atop the battlefield ranks, cr HELIUM TROOPS and THARKS alike left unable to get out of way. The Zodangan Carrier continues on-- ~-engaging a Second Helium Battleship, just leaving the c The carrier's CANNONS disable this one too -- causing it and CRASH into a “floating” section of Helium. Aboard the Bomber, Carter, Dejah, Tars and Sola look grim

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: I want that ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dejah takes over, piloting the Bomber toward the monstrou Carrier, as Tars rallies his Tharks atop its open-deck. T all hook into RAPPEL-LINES built into the deck railing--

dialogues.speaker: ON MY SIGNAL
dialogues.text: --and as Dejah suddenly swoops the ship upward, bringing broadsides at carrier-deck level, Tars LEAPS OFF-- --plummeting on his rappel-line to LAND atop the deck. So the other Tharks follow suit...like pirates swinging from riggings! Their swords and axes cut their lines free-- --and they CHARGE the Zodangan Soldiers refueling the Fig and manning the deck-cannons! ‘Woola dives in too!  117. Zodangan gun-blasts RICOCHET off Thark shields and as the “recharge” -- but not quite fast enough -- the Tharks are them, STORMING and SLICING. INT./EXT. POWELL‘S AIRSHIP BANG! Gunfire RIPS into the ship as it SHAKES uncontrolla Carter and Dejah brace for impact--

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Hold on! We‘re going down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --as the ship HITS the carrier deck and SKIDS like a skip stone. SPARKS shower and wings CATCH FIRE as -- BANG! -- crashes to rest amidst parked Assault Fliers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell watches in dismay as the Tharks OVERWHELM the Deck Soldiers and climb toward the bridge--

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Ready my ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zodangan GUARDS rush Powell toward an Assault Flier, pass right by the Airship’s wreckage-- --as Carter and Dejah tumble out, battered but alive. The Guards start SHOOTING and they return it, felling two-- --but Powell has already LEAPT aboard the Assault Flier a POWERS its engine, taking off into the fray-- --and Carter looks up to see Dejah aboard a second Flier-

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: This is not your war...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: It is now. ~-he jumps aboard with her and she GUNS the engine, pilot Flier in pursuit of Powell's!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tharks STORM the bridge, wiping out the Zodangan ADMI Tars leaps into the captain’s chair, working pedals and switches. The giant behemoth now pivots--  118. --to face the rest of the Zodangan Carrier Fleet. Four mo CARRIERS are entering the valley. Tars nods to Sola:

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: One down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next Carrier comes broadside with a Helium Battleship CANNONS blaze; GRAPPLES are fired -- the two behemoths be locked together at close quarters! Zodangan SOLDIERS come rushing over the decks, swinging from ropes and racing ac “attack planks” that link the ships-- --~and just as they start to overwhelm the Helium crew-- --the lead ZODANGAN CARRIER rises into view off the far s With Tars’ THIRTY THARKS aboard. They leap, charge and immediately turn the tide...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While, having dropped them off, Tars sets his course for more Zodangan Carriers, grouped close. Sola flips switche OVERRIDING the ship's controls. ALARMS blare. But father- daughter hold the course...

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: Let us see you fight one of your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell‘s Flier ROCKETS through a break in the SHIELDS, in city, dodging the dogfights of airships and Malagors-~ --with Carter and Dejah‘s second flier in hot pursuit. De flies while Carter mans the DECK CANNON--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Stay with him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GROUND FRAY teems in full-force, with Thark SWORDS an SHIELDS battling the intermittent Zodangan RADIUM FIRE-- --as the MASSIVE SHADOW of the Carrier falls overhead...a twenty-some THARKS come plummeting down on RAPPEL-LINES-- CRASH! To LAND right in the midst of the fighting! The st force and Woola SJ,ASH free and join the ground war!  119.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The commandeered Zodangan Carrier DRIFTS into the path of three others, despite the WARNING ALARMS they‘re sounding others split to let it pass between-~-

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: For Helium.

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: For Thark. --as Tars and Sola race for the deck’s edge on long ropes LEAPING off and plummeting toward the ground war-- --as the Zodangan Carrier DETONATES in a domino-chain of EXPLOSIONS, BLASTING APART like a neutron bomb-- --sending its FLAMING SHRAPNEL into the three other Carri BLASTING them out of commission, capsizing them and drift them groundward like three Hindenburgs-- --to CRASH atop the battlefields on the Zodangan side, CR many thousands of their own soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CHEER goes up from the Helium ranks as Tars and Sola la among them. Tars spots Major Jakkal FIGHTING valiantly up ahead...but just as he’s about to reach him-- --the sheer number of men Jakkal is battling overwhelm hi Swords slash Jakkal‘s limbs, dropping him to his knees... another sword IMPALES his heart-- --as Tars RACES OVER, swinging swords wildly and slashing Zodangans apart. Their line falls momentarily back -- as drops to his knees, cradling his dying friend...

dialogues.speaker: JAKKAL
dialogues.text: It was a good war, my King... ...as he expires. Tars shudders with rage, not seeing a Zodangan BREAK through the Thark ranks, two PISTOLS held-

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: --as the Zodangan CHARGES with a roar, FIRING RADIUM SHOT Tars' shields barely catch. Now at point-blank range-- --until a SWORD-STRIKE splits the man in half. As he fall fars peers over his shield...to see Sola standing there.  120.

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: You must be more careful. With a proud look, side-by-side, they rejoin the fray...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Dejah’s Flier dips and dodges the city’s spire gaining on Powell‘s Flier--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Get us alongside him! So Dejah SHOOTS their craft low, skimming the city street Powell loses sight of them amid the spires-- ~-and then suddenly sees them SWEEPING HIGH, right at him --as Carter LEAPS just like Tars did from the Malagor... barely missing colliding with a city spire-- --as he CRASHES onto Powell's FLIER, as it VEERS SHARPLY! struggle! Powell GAROTTES Carter with his own dog tags--~ --but Carter back-flips himself free, turning the tables. rips off his dog tags as Powell rushes him -- smashing hi against the controls. The Flier VEERS again-- --and SMASHES WINGS with Dejah‘s FLIER, fusing them toget Both ships have lost control as they SMOKE and WOBBLE groundward! The King’s Compound lies dead ahead! Carter fends Powell off, trying to reach the steering sti while Dejah tries to steer them, but it’s no use--

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: We've lost control! We have to jump!

dialogues.speaker: WE HAVE TO JUMP
dialogues.text: There's a palace tower closing in, right in their path -- Carter and Powell struggle, right in each other's faces--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: We fight, we die. We have to jump. A staredown. Powell knows it's true. And so they break-- --or rather, Carter does. Powell doesn’t. Because he find BELT is snared to the Flier’s steering stick...linked by Carter's DOG TAGS. Powell goes. pale--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Womb to tomb.  121. --as Carter spins to the back of the Flier, LEAPING OFF j Dejah does, and grabbing her hand in mid-air dropping saf the ground below--

dialogues.speaker: AS THE TWO FLIERS COLLIDE WITH THE TOWER
dialogues.text: And BLAST through it, with Powell alone still aboard--

dialogues.speaker: TO CRASH-LAND IN THE PALACE GARDENS
dialogues.text: In a massive EXPLOSION -- TRENCHING across the gravel pat all three are thrown from the wreckage! BLACK SMOKE fills gardens, obscuring our view... .»».as the network of Helium FORCE-SHIELDS finally falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire SKY seems to CRACKLE with ENERGY -~ and then a RIPPLING SONIC BOOM signals the loss of the aerial shield DEAFENING CHEER goes up from the ground forces...as they redouble their assault. Only a matter of time now...

dialogues.speaker: TARDOS MORS
dialogues.text: The city is theirs... The Tharks and Heliumites fight valiantly, but they’re ju match for Zodanga’s incredible numbers...as the King and trade a look of fear and failure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Tars Tarkas FIGHTS like a Thark possessed, with Sol MOWING DOWN Zodangans at his side. But their numbers are dwindling, as they find themselves in a group of TEN THAR --now encircled by FIVE HUNDRED ZODANGANS. And many THOUS more still advancing through the valley. Tars and Sola kn end is here too...

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: It's been an honor to fight for you... Father.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: The honor was mine. He reaches out for her hand...as she takes it and they br their SHIELDS together, huddled as one as the Zodangans B THROUGH, FIRING a FUSILLADE of radium fire...  122.

dialogues.speaker: AS A CAVALCADE OF HORNS SOUND
dialogues.text: Echoing throughout the valley, as if from all directions! forces on the battlefield all pause--

dialogues.speaker: TO SEE THE GREEN-AND-BLACK FLAGS OF THE THARK RIDERS
dialogues.text: Now appear on the ridgetops...to east and to west, to nor south, to all points of the compass...

dialogues.speaker: LEADING THE SIX OTHER TRIBES OF THARKS
dialogues.text: from the disparate deserts. All gathered as a united force...creating an army HALF A MILLION STRONG on the rid --and also flooding into the valley on THOAT-back, chargi Zodangan battalions from the rear! Where the odds were on against-one...they’re now even. And “even” means in favor the Tharks. On the battlefield, Tars and Sola raise their heads...see new THARK TRIBES cascading down the ridges... Atop the overlook, Tardos Mors watches in wonder...as the THARK TRIBES flood the valley, dispatching the Zodangans fury and ease! The tide has turned!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far from the front, there’s only smoke and silence...and CHERRY BLOSSOMS -- fluttering to rest upon Carter and Dej wrapped in one another's arms in the trenched-earth wake crash landing. Battered, but alive. They stir, rising to see the BURNING WRECKAGE further ahe Where Powell’s hawk-helmet sits upended, like a headstone hellish flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! CANNONS still THUNDER as Carter and Dejah arrive fr gardens. Joining Tardos Mors and Helium GENERALS...

dialogues.speaker: TARDOS MORS
dialogues.text: Dejah! She’s alive! DEJAH! He embraces his daughter with profound amazement...

dialogues.speaker: TARDOS MORS
dialogues.text: How is this possible?

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Because of one man, Father. This is Captain John Carter -- of Earth. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEJAH (cont'd) It was he who brought the Tharks. It was he who made the difference. The King bows, astonished, and Carter returns it...as the to face the valley...where the Zodangans retreat, and Tha Heliumites fight triumphantly, side-by-side...

dialogues.speaker: TARDOS MORS
dialogues.text: Look at it. In all our history...what no man has ever imagined...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Only a princess.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: EXT. KING’S COMPOUND ~ HELIUM - DUSK As the sun sets, bathing the battered city in a magical g Carter stands silhouetted on a balcony overlook. There’s far-off ECHO of cheers and victory music...

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Didn‘t I promise you it'd be beautiful? Carter turns. Dejah's standing there, in royal regalia.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Is there anything like it on Earth?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (taking her in) Never will be. Dejah steps to his side, regarding the view...

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Take it, John. Remember it. So that wherever you are, on this or any planet, you may close your eyes and still see it... She passes her hand over his face, closing his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Your new home. He opens them. She stands before him with a smile. Withou another word, to the sound of a distant celebration and i shadow of a setting sun... ...they find each other’s embrace, lost in a valiant kiss

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. DEJAH‘S QUARTERS - NIGHT OMINOUS THUNDER rumbles, rousing Woola from sleep. He's c outside a door, GROWLING at shadows standing over him. A ADVISER and two SOLDIERS look pale...

dialogues.speaker: COURT ADVISER
dialogues.text: Wake the princess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woola BOUNDS IN, scampering to the bed where Carter and D are sleeping, wrapped in each other’s arms. They wake to LIGHTNING crashing outside the window, giving an ominous hue to the FLICKERING CLOUDS--

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: (alert at once) What's happened? The advisers trade a look of profound fear...

dialogues.speaker: COURT ADVISER
dialogues.text: Your Highness. The King is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tardos Mors sits dead at his desk. A KNIFE pierces his heart...and the diamond is gone from his pendant’s crest. Dejah and Carter charge in -- to see Tars Tarkas, Sola an King's senior STAFF already there. Dejah GASPS -- and run her father’s side, collapsing there, weeping.

dialogues.speaker: COURT ADVISER
dialogues.text: There were guards outside. Throughout the palace and the grounds. No one was seen. And yet someone was here. Through her tears, Dejah touches the blade’s hilt...and s something hanging from it. Carter’s dog tags.

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: The stone of his crest has been taken.

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: The key. She and Carter trade a sudden look...as more HEAT-LIGHTNI CRASHES right outside, striking city spires. The building TREMBLES from impact.

dialogues.speaker: SOLA
dialogues.text: What’s happened to the sky?!

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: It‘s the Atmosphere Plant.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: He's inside. And off their foreboding look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blanket of PURPLE-BLACK CYCLONE STORMCLOUDS envelop the the horizon. LIGHTNING crackles incessantly as BLACK ASH in a blizzard, like a black snow... ...as a Helium INTERCEPTOR sears through the clouds, narr missing a thicket of LIGHTNING STRIKES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The airship’s hatch opens, allowing Carter, Dejah and Tar the hostile elements. The field of blue flowers has withe BARREN SOIL. Dejah holds up her DIAMOND STONE...and all shield their e its BEAM OF ENERGY is BLINDINGLY cast upon the wall--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter, Dejah and Tars race through the entry “airlock,” their wounds mysteriously HEAL, nearing the RIPPLING ‘DOO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and at the balcony overlooking the metropolis of machin much of it now SMOKING and SPARKING -- they find the Orov lying dead on the floor. In a pool of SILVER BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The man asked me if I wanted to go home, Carter. Said he asked you too. On the HOLOGRAM WALKWAY leading to the “pathway,” with it of RED FIRE-GEMS hanging like constellations-- --Powell now RE-MATERIALIZES into view, with his face BAD BURNED. With a radium rifle.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Why the hell didn‘t you? Carter looks to Dejah and Tars...and then back:

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I am home.  126.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: Yes. Now you see. How can we ever go back to who we were? Ordinary. Insignificant.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Why did you kill him?

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: c'mon, Carter. It's what I'm good at. (smugly) Not even an Orovar can stop what he can’t see. Or a king. Dejah seethes. Powell advances, noting smoking machinery:

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: I‘ve caused some damage, but I can fix it. Once I learn how it works -- how to control it.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You can’t.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: No? Like I can’t defy gravity? Or travel through time and space? We can save this planet -- you and me. If Helium resists, we'll cut off their rain. Their hydrogen, nitrogen, oxygen. Until they realize I WAS HERE

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I won't let you destroy them. Powell stops. It's a standoff.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: I have a hundred years more experience on you, Carter. You can't stop me.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I don’t have to. Powell frowns. With that,

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I only have to send you home. Carter pulls a SWORD...and hurls it over Powell's head...to land on the “pathway” pedestal. It ACTIVATES th “pathway”. The CRYSTALS start to glow--  127.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Say hi to Earth for me. --and Carter CHARGES! Powell FIRES his rifle just as Cart LEAPS overhead. Powell tries to track him but-- --GREEN RADIUM BOLTS explode at his feet! Tars and Dejah opened fire! Powell’s RIFLE is shot away-- --and Powell swiftly sweeps a helmet-visor across his fac activates his armor’s “MIRAGING.” With a RIPPLE, his figu becomes a near~invisible DISTORTION OF HEAT. Tars and Dej can’t see him...and neither can Carter as-- ~-a sudden CUT opens across his chest. Carter staggers, s by an invisible blade! The DISTORTION then plants a kick chest, sending him FLYING-- --to CRASH-LAND within the domed “pathway” as it starts t and a SWIRLING WIND begins to build-- --as Powell's HEAT-MIRAGE, invisible sword in hand, march toward him, victorious--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Carter struggles up, trying to pinpoint the DISTORTED AIR --as a deep GASH opens on Carter’s leg, and another GASH arm. He‘’s getting sliced up by his invisible foe. Carter retrieves his sword and tries to parry. His blade BASHED this way and that...and then falls-- --as Carter feels an invisible swordpoint PRESS INTO his drawing blood--

dialogues.speaker: POWELL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Prepare to die on two planets. --and as the DISTORTION OF A BLADE is drawn back-- --from the balcony, Tars Tarkas aims his rifle...at Carte

dialogues.speaker: TARS TARKAS
dialogues.text: He’s mine. --and FIRES! Carter sees the GREEN RADIUM BOLT shooting r at him! And then suddenly it DETONATES a foot from his fa CRACKLING GREEN ENERGY to illuminate Powell. Shot in the His compromised armor now fails--  128. ~--and he RE-MATERIALIZES! Carter scrambles for his sword Powell staggers back to full strength -- and their blades COLLIDE! They strike and counter, slamming swords togethe --as the MAELSTROM of wind and light swirling around them builds. The FIRE-GEMS glow hotter-- -~obscuring the view of Dejah and Tars from the balcony-- --as Powell's savage blows drive Carter back, slipping on holo-walk's edge as he loses his balance-- --teetering over the abyss of machinery! His sword falls! as Powell swings his blade again, Carter JUMPS, leaping o to the far side of the “pathway”-- --where he snares two of Tars’' SWORDS -- as they’re thro him -- out of mid-air! Powell pauses in surprise. Carter has two swords, once in each hand--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You may have the experience. You may own the technology. But you were never trained by Tharks. --and with a murderous look, he charges. Powell meets him halfway, BASHING swords together, trying to fend off ever blows with his lone blade, but it’s all too much as-- --Carter SLICES him apart and RUNS HIM THROUGH. Powell fa the ground, shocked and dying.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Goodbye, James. Carter’s in the middle of the “pathway,” with a fifty-foo distance separating him from Tars, Dejah and safety, with HUM growing DEAFENING and the FIRE-GEMS ever-brighter-- --building toward their climactic BLINDING LIGHT--

dialogues.speaker: DEJAH
dialogues.text: Jump! Now! JUMP!!! --and Carter does, LEAPING the gap, arcing right toward h

dialogues.speaker: JUST AS ENERGY BOLTS FIRE FROM THE FIRE-GEMS
dialogues.text: Throughout the crystal canopy, activating, creating a WEB LIGHT BEAMS connecting Carter, still within-- --and just as he reaches her -- and touches Dejah's hand-  129. --he’s suddenly jerked back into the air, toward the cent the chamber as Dejah CRIES OUT and her vision of him DISA in a BLINDING BLAST OF RED!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wildly kinetic series of fragmented images. Stars, come planets, seen for only two or three frames. Like galactic strobe lights. Sound ROARS and then SILENCES. We're racin through a dark tunnel, with little to light our way-- --and as the STROBING IMAGES take the shape of a BLUE PLA wisping clouds and a forest thicket we’re hurtling toward

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amidst autumn leaves and barren branches, ANGLE FINDS a flattened, scorched circle...within which Carter lies. He struggles up, disoriented-~- --and sees the body of Powell lying nearby. Carter turns over. He's made the journey too -- as a dead man. Carter notes the familiar trees, leaves and sound of bird Clouds and a faint full moon in the sky...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Told you I‘d bring you home... He closes Powell's eyes and then notices a cord around hi He pulls it into view...to reveal the King’s DIAMOND STON affixed to it. Carter grips it tightly...as if wanting to hang onto a wo knows he’s now lost...and then snaps it free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter marches up a rise, wearing the DIAMOND STONE aroun own neck. He tucks it beneath his shirt-- --as he hears SHOTS fired. Carter tenses...but then hears WHOOPS and CRIES. A group of scruffy YOUNG BOYS appear at rise, seeing him below--

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Sir! Were you in the war, sir?! Confused, Carter nods. The boy grins, slaps a newspaper--  130.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: It’s over, sir! General Lee surrendered! We can go home! The boys run off. Carter hurries up the rise and sees--

dialogues.speaker: A HUGE FORMER BATTLEFIELD
dialogues.text: At the foot of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Where CANNONS li abandoned, and SOLDIERS in Civil War dress -- blues and g are crossing the field to opposite sides.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Home, he said. Home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter walks among the CIVIL WAR VETERANS, incredulous...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It was the Virginia I had once longed for. But it was not my time. (beat) Toy From that moment forth, it was ina memory. In a dream.. He looks up to a mountain ridge, where there’s a small CA high on a hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter stands in the doorway. A modest one-room cabin. Du and broken furniture. Abandoned due to the war.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Of a life perhaps lost forever... He looks again at the DIAMOND STONE around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cabin is furnished now. As we PICK UP Carter at a des the window, again writing in his journal...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What I‘d lived through had changed me. I was no longer like other men. The years would pass, and they would die...but I did not. ANGLE PANS to the window and the Shenandoah Valley below, see a TIMELAPSE VERSION of over a century of progress. Pa roads, horses to cars, hamlets to cities...  131.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The lifespan of that other world had followed me here... (beat) On this planet, I now live as a stranger. And as ANGLE COMPLETES THE 360 PAN, back to the room, it’ modern-day HOME. Decorated in an astronomy theme. Charts solar system. Telescopes. And drawings of Thark, Helium a Dejah... ...as ANGLE returns to Carter's desk. The seat is empty. journal sits there. And now, a DOOR opens in the b.g. and FIGURE marches in, crossing to the desk--

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But still I believe... There is a way back. And one day...I will find it... A way for someone to answer my call. To my love, my friends, my home... --and sets down a “Washington Post” newspaper, dated 2005 it’s thrown open to an interior page... ...aS a HAND circles a minor story in the bottom corner, headlined “7.4 Earthquake Ravages Central Africa.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIGURE in modern adventurer’s gear stands at a familiar overlook, gazing off with binoculars at a lush mountains small black SCAR now in its side.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I won't tell you where I’m going. I won't tell you how to follow. But I'll leave behind my story...for anyone who wants to know what ever happened to Captain John Carter. The figure turns, to reveal Carter -- over a hundred year later, and yet he hasn't aged a day. The DIAMOND STONE ha around his neck. He tucks it under his shirt, and has a l bite of a Baby Ruth candy bar...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I believe in a better world. A world without war. A world of peace. ...and then heads for the mountain. Into the jungle. With MOON hanging brightly high above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where EARTH hangs prominently in the same position, blue brilliant and mysterious... ...being watched by silhouettes standing all together. Ta Tarkas. Sola. Woola. And Dejah Thoris...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: For I know, in my heart I know... And now Dejah‘s SILHOUETTE edges aside...to reveal she’s the hand of a SILHOUETTED LITTLE BOY.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ..-my future's waiting. And as a triumphant soundtrack FANFARE rises, we-- cuT TO BLACK.
